              "code": "/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    console.log('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let apiVersion = 'v10';\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        console.log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name);\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  describe('SimpleRestApi Tests', () => {\n    let api;\n    \n    beforeAll(() => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      api = new SimpleRestApi({\n        authType: authType,\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    });\n    \n    test('should get user profile info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should get user profile info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await api.request('get', path);\n        console.log(' Success! User profile info retrieved');\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error getting user profile info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should search for my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should search for my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const searchResults = await api.request('get', path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${searchResults.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(searchResults).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(searchResults.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error searching for documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n});\n",

              "content": "I'll update the `free-account.integration.test.js` file to clear the terminal once before the entire test run, rather than between each test.\n\nHere's a list of updates to each file with their name and path:\n\n* [`tests/free-account.integration.test.js`](tests/free-account.integration.test.js):\n  * Add a function to clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n  * Add terminal clearing to the main `beforeAll` hook that runs once before all tests\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\free-account.integration.test.js\n/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    console.log('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let apiVersion = 'v10';\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        console.log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name);\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  describe('SimpleRestApi Tests', () => {\n    let api;\n    \n    beforeAll(() => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      api = new SimpleRestApi({\n        authType: authType,\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    });\n    \n    test('should get user profile info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should get user profile info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await api.request('get', path);\n        console.log(' Success! User profile info retrieved');\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error getting user profile info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should search for my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should search for my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const searchResults = await api.request('get', path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${searchResults.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(searchResults).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(searchResults.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error searching for documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n});\n```\n\nThis change clears the terminal once at the beginning of the test run, when the main `beforeAll` hook runs, rather than clearing it between each test."

        {
          "value": "/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    process.stdout.write('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Custom log function to avoid console.log prefixes\nfunction log(...args) {\n  process.stdout.write(args.join(' ') + '\\n');\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let message = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  message += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    message += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    message += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  message += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return message;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let apiVersion = 'v10';\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        log('User Name:', userInfo.name);\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  describe('SimpleRestApi Tests', () => {\n    let api;\n    \n    beforeAll(() => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      api = new SimpleRestApi({\n        authType: authType,\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    });\n    \n    test('should get user profile info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should get user profile info';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await api.request('get', path);\n        log(' Success! User profile info retrieved');\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error getting user profile info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should search for my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should search for my documents';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const searchResults = await api.request('get', path, queryParams);\n        log(` Success! Found ${searchResults.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(searchResults).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(searchResults.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error searching for documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n});\n```\n\nThis second approach replaces all ",

require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return message;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let apiVersion = 'v10';\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn('WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        log('User Name:', userInfo.name);\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  describe('SimpleRestApi Tests', () => {\n    let api;\n    \n    beforeAll(() => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      api = new SimpleRestApi({\n        authType: authType,\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    });\n    \n    test('should get user profile info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should get user profile info';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await api.request('get', path);\n        log(' Success! User profile info retrieved');\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error getting user profile info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should search for my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should search for my documents';\n      log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const searchResults = await api.request('get', path, queryParams);\n        log(` Success! Found ${searchResults.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(searchResults).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(searchResults.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error searching for documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n});\n```\n\nThis second approach replaces all `console.log` calls with a custom `log` function that uses `process.stdout.write` directly, avoiding the Jest prefixes. I've also updated the `clearTerminal` function to use the same method for consistency."

            {
              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "Based on the issue where Jest is still showing \"console.log\" prefixes in the output, I'll suggest options to solve this problem.\n\nOptions:\n1. Create a setup file that overrides console.log to use process.stdout.write directly\n2. Update the test file to use a custom logging function instead of console.log\n3. Modify the Jest config to use a reporter that doesn't prefix logs\n\nLet's go with option 1 as it's the most comprehensive solution and doesn't require changing all console.log calls.\n\nHere's a list of updates to each file with their name and path:\n\n* [`tests/setup-integration.js`](tests/setup-integration.js): Create a setup file to override console behaviors\n* [`jest.config.js`](jest.config.js): Update to use the setup file\n\nHere's the code for each file:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\setup-integration.js\n/**\n * Setup file for integration tests\n * Overrides console methods to avoid Jest prefixes\n */\n\n// Store original console methods\nconst originalLog = console.log;\nconst originalInfo = console.info;\nconst originalWarn = console.warn;\nconst originalError = console.error;\n\n// Override console.log to use process.stdout directly\nconsole.log = (...args) => {\n  process.stdout.write(args.map(arg => \n    typeof arg === 'object' ? JSON.stringify(arg, null, 2) : String(arg)\n  ).join(' ') + '\\n');\n};\n\n// Override console.info to use process.stdout directly\nconsole.info = (...args) => {\n  process.stdout.write(' ' + args.map(arg => \n    typeof arg === 'object' ? JSON.stringify(arg, null, 2) : String(arg)\n  ).join(' ') + '\\n');\n};\n\n// Override console.warn to use process.stderr directly\nconsole.warn = (...args) => {\n  process.stderr.write(' ' + args.map(arg => \n    typeof arg === 'object' ? JSON.stringify(arg, null, 2) : String(arg)\n  ).join(' ') + '\\n');\n};\n\n// Override console.error to use process.stderr directly\nconsole.error = (...args) => {\n  process.stderr.write(' ' + args.map(arg => \n    typeof arg === 'object' ? JSON.stringify(arg, null, 2) : String(arg)\n  ).join(' ') + '\\n');\n};\n\n// Restore original methods when tests are done\nafterAll(() => {\n  console.log = originalLog;\n  console.info = originalInfo;\n  console.warn = originalWarn;\n  console.error = originalError;\n});\n```\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\jest.config.js\n/**\n * Jest configuration for integration tests\n */\nmodule.exports = {\n  // Run tests matching these patterns\n  testMatch: [\n    \"**/*.integration.test.js\"\n  ],\n  \n  // Skip tests in node_modules\n  testPathIgnorePatterns: [\n    \"/node_modules/\"\n  ],\n  \n  // Increase timeout for long-running tests (e.g., Python environment setup)\n  testTimeout: 30000,\n  \n  // Show test output details\n  verbose: false,\n  \n  // Allow test files to be detected properly\n  rootDir: \".\",\n  \n  // Use Node.js as test environment\n  testEnvironment: \"node\",\n  \n  // Configure coverage collection (optional)\n  collectCoverageFrom: [\n    \"src/**/*.js\",\n    \"!**/node_modules/**\"\n  ],\n  \n  // Run setup files before tests\n  setupFilesAfterEnv: [\"./tests/setup-integration.js\"],\n  \n  // Allow console output during tests (helpful for debugging)\n  silent: false\n};\n```\n\nThis solution overrides the console methods to write directly to stdout/stderr, avoiding Jest's automatic prefixes. The setup file is referenced in the Jest configuration, ensuring it runs before tests. After all tests complete, the original console methods are restored."
            }

        {
          "value": "/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    process.stdout.write('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        console.log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        \n        // Display relevant user information\n        console.log('\\n===== User Profile Information =====');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User ID:', userInfo.id || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User Type:', userInfo.type || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Email:', userInfo.email || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Plan Name:', userInfo.plan?.name || 'Not provided');\n        \n        // Display OAuth scopes if present\n        if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== OAuth Scopes =====');\n          userInfo.oauth2Scopes.forEach(scope => {\n            console.log(`- ${scope}`);\n          });\n        }\n        \n        // Display complete user object for debugging\n        console.log('\\n===== Complete User Object =====');\n        console.log(JSON.stringify(userInfo, null, 2));\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n\n    test('should check API permissions', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should check API permissions';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        \n        console.log('\\n===== API Key Permissions Analysis =====');\n        \n        // Check if user has a name - might indicate a properly configured user account\n        if (userInfo.name) {\n          console.log(' API key is associated with a named user account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' API key may not be associated with a fully configured user account');\n        }\n        \n        // Check for document access permissions\n        if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          const hasReadAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Read') || scope.includes('read'));\n          const hasWriteAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Write') || scope.includes('write'));\n          \n          console.log(` Read access: ${hasReadAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n          console.log(` Write access: ${hasWriteAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n          \n          if (!hasReadAccess) {\n            console.log(' This API key does not have document read permissions');\n            console.log('   Add \"OAuth2Read\" scope to enable document access');\n          }\n        } else {\n          console.log(' No OAuth scopes found for this API key');\n          console.log('   This may indicate limited permissions');\n        }\n        \n        // Check plan limitations\n        if (userInfo.plan) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.plan.name}`);\n          console.log(` Plan level: ${userInfo.plan.level || 'Not specified'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check if this is an enterprise account\n        if (userInfo.enterpriseInfo) {\n          console.log(' This is an Enterprise account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' This is not an Enterprise account');\n        }\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error checking API permissions:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        \n        // Display document info if found\n        if (publicDocs.items && publicDocs.items.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== Document List =====');\n          publicDocs.items.forEach((doc, index) => {\n            console.log(`\\nDocument ${index + 1}:`);\n            console.log(`- Name: ${doc.name}`);\n            console.log(`- ID: ${doc.id}`);\n            console.log(`- Created: ${new Date(doc.createdAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n            console.log(`- Modified: ${new Date(doc.modifiedAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n          });\n        }\n        \n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        if (error.response && error.response.status === 401) {\n          console.log(' Permission issue detected: 401 Unauthorized');\n          console.log('   This API key may not have document read permissions');\n          console.log('   Ensure the API key has at least \"OAuth2Read\" scope');\n        }\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  // Keep existing SimpleRestApi Tests section...\n});\n```\n\nThis update:\n\n1. Enhances the user session info test to display:\n   - Basic user profile info (name, ID, email)\n   - OAuth scopes if present\n   - The complete user object for thorough inspection\n\n2. Adds a new test specifically to analyze API key permissions:\n   - Checks for association with a named user account\n   - Analyzes OAuth scopes to determine read/write permissions\n   - Examines plan limitations and enterprise status\n\n3. Improves the document list test with:\n   - More detailed document information if found\n   - Additional error handling for 401 errors with helpful guidance\n\nThe tests are designed to work with the existing authentication code and provide a comprehensive view of what permissions your API key has after successful authentication.",

'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n          console.log(` Write access: ${hasWriteAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n          \n          if (!hasReadAccess) {\n            console.log(' This API key does not have document read permissions');\n            console.log('   Add \"OAuth2Read\" scope to enable document access');\n          }\n        } else {\n          console.log(' No OAuth scopes found for this API key');\n          console.log('   This may indicate limited permissions');\n        }\n        \n        // Check plan limitations\n        if (userInfo.plan) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.plan.name}`);\n          console.log(` Plan level: ${userInfo.plan.level || 'Not specified'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check if this is an enterprise account\n        if (userInfo.enterpriseInfo) {\n          console.log(' This is an Enterprise account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' This is not an Enterprise account');\n        }\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error checking API permissions:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success!               "role": "assistant",
              "content": "To show what permissions an account has when authentication succeeds, we need to modify the `free-account.integration.test.js` file to display the complete session info response and add a specific test to check permissions.\n\nHere's a list of updates to the file:\n\n* [`tests/free-account.integration.test.js`](tests/free-account.integration.test.js):\n  * Expand the existing session info test to show the complete user info object\n  * Add a new test to specifically check user permissions and OAuth scopes\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\free-account.integration.test.js\n/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    process.stdout.write('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        console.log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        \n        // Display relevant user information\n        console.log('\\n===== User Profile Information =====');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User ID:', userInfo.id || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User Type:', userInfo.type || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Email:', userInfo.email || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Plan Name:', userInfo.plan?.name || 'Not provided');\n        \n        // Display OAuth scopes if present\n        if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== OAuth Scopes =====');\n          userInfo.oauth2Scopes.forEach(scope => {\n            console.log(`- ${scope}`);\n          });\n        }\n        \n        // Display complete user object for debugging\n        console.log('\\n===== Complete User Object =====');\n        console.log(JSON.stringify(userInfo, null, 2));\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n\n    test('should check API permissions', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should check API permissions';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        \n        console.log('\\n===== API Key Permissions Analysis =====');\n        \n        // Check if user has a name - might indicate a properly configured user account\n        if (userInfo.name) {\n          console.log(' API key is associated with a named user account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' API key may not be associated with a fully configured user account');\n        }\n        \n        // Check for document access permissions\n        if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          const hasReadAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Read') || scope.includes('read'));\n          const hasWriteAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Write') || scope.includes('write'));\n          \n          console.log(` Read access: ${hasReadAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n          console.log(` Write access: ${hasWriteAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n          \n          if (!hasReadAccess) {\n            console.log(' This API key does not have document read permissions');\n            console.log('   Add \"OAuth2Read\" scope to enable document access');\n          }\n        } else {\n          console.log(' No OAuth scopes found for this API key');\n          console.log('   This may indicate limited permissions');\n        }\n        \n        // Check plan limitations\n        if (userInfo.plan) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.plan.name}`);\n          console.log(` Plan level: ${userInfo.plan.level || 'Not specified'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check if this is an enterprise account\n        if (userInfo.enterpriseInfo) {\n          console.log(' This is an Enterprise account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' This is not an Enterprise account');\n        }\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error checking API permissions:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        \n        // Display document info if found\n        if (publicDocs.items && publicDocs.items.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== Document List =====');\n          publicDocs.items.forEach((doc, index) => {\n            console.log(`\\nDocument ${index + 1}:`);\n            console.log(`- Name: ${doc.name}`);\n            console.log(`- ID: ${doc.id}`);\n            console.log(`- Created: ${new Date(doc.createdAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n            console.log(`- Modified: ${new Date(doc.modifiedAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n          });\n        }\n        \n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        if (error.response && error.response.status === 401) {\n          console.log(' Permission issue detected: 401 Unauthorized');\n          console.log('   This API key may not have document read permissions');\n          console.log('   Ensure the API key has at least \"OAuth2Read\" scope');\n        }\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  // Keep existing SimpleRestApi Tests section...\n});\n```\n\nThis update:\n\n1. Enhances the user session info test to display:\n   - Basic user profile info (name, ID, email)\n   - OAuth scopes if present\n   - The complete user object for thorough inspection\n\n2. Adds a new test specifically to analyze API key permissions:\n   - Checks for association with a named user account\n   - Analyzes OAuth scopes to determine read/write permissions\n   - Examines plan limitations and enterprise status\n\n3. Improves the document list test with:\n   - More detailed document information if found\n   - Additional error handling for 401 errors with helpful guidance\n\nThe tests are designed to work with the existing authentication code and provide a comprehensive view of what permissions your API key has after successful authentication."

        {
          "value": "/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    process.stdout.write('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\n// Helper function to analyze OAuth2 scope bitwise value\nfunction analyzeOAuth2Scopes(scopeValue) {\n  // Common OAuth2 scope bit values\n  const scopeBits = {\n    OAuth2Read: 1,        // 2^0 = 1\n    OAuth2Write: 2,       // 2^1 = 2\n    OAuth2Delete: 4,      // 2^2 = 4\n    OAuth2ReadPII: 8      // 2^3 = 8\n    // There are more scopes but these are the common ones\n  };\n\n  const results = {};\n  for (const [scopeName, bitValue] of Object.entries(scopeBits)) {\n    results[scopeName] = Boolean(scopeValue & bitValue);\n  }\n  return results;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        console.log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        \n        // Display relevant user information\n        console.log('\\n===== User Profile Information =====');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User ID:', userInfo.id || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User Type:', userInfo.type || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Email:', userInfo.email || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Plan Name:', userInfo.planGroup || userInfo.plan?.name || 'Not provided');\n        \n        // Display OAuth scopes\n        console.log('\\n===== OAuth Scopes =====');\n        if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          console.log('OAuth2 Scope Value (bitwise):', userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n          const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n          for (const [scope, enabled] of Object.entries(scopeAnalysis)) {\n            console.log(`- ${scope}: ${enabled ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled'}`);\n          }\n        } else if (Array.isArray(userInfo.oauth2Scopes) && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          userInfo.oauth2Scopes.forEach(scope => {\n            console.log(`- ${scope}`);\n          });\n        } else {\n          console.log('No OAuth scopes found or scope format is unexpected');\n        }\n        \n        // Display roles if available\n        if (userInfo.roles && userInfo.roles.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== User Roles =====');\n          userInfo.roles.forEach(role => {\n            console.log(`- ${role}`);\n          });\n        }\n        \n        // Display complete user object for debugging\n        console.log('\\n===== Complete User Object =====');\n        console.log(JSON.stringify(userInfo, null, 2));\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n\n    test('should check API permissions', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should check API permissions';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        \n        console.log('\\n===== API Key Permissions Analysis =====');\n        \n        // Check if user has a name - might indicate a properly configured user account\n        if (userInfo.name) {\n          console.log(' API key is associated with a named user account:', userInfo.name);\n        } else {\n          console.log(' API key may not be associated with a fully configured user account');\n        }\n        \n        // Check for document access permissions\n        let hasReadAccess = false;\n        let hasWriteAccess = false;\n        \n        if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n          hasReadAccess = scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Read;\n          hasWriteAccess = scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Write;\n          \n          console.log('OAuth2 Scope Value:', userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n        } else if (Array.isArray(userInfo.oauth2Scopes) && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          hasReadAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Read') || scope.includes('read'));\n          hasWriteAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Write') || scope.includes('write'));\n        }\n        \n        console.log(` Read access: ${hasReadAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n        console.log(` Write access: ${hasWriteAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n        \n        if (!hasReadAccess) {\n          console.log(' This API key does not have document read permissions');\n          console.log('   Add \"OAuth2Read\" scope to enable document access');\n        }\n        \n        // Check user roles\n        if (userInfo.roles && userInfo.roles.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n User Roles:');\n          userInfo.roles.forEach(role => {\n            console.log(`   - ${role}`);\n          });\n          \n          const isDeveloper = userInfo.roles.includes('DEVELOPER');\n          console.log(` Developer role: ${isDeveloper ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check plan limitations\n        if (userInfo.planGroup) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.planGroup}`);\n        } else if (userInfo.plan) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.plan.name}`);\n          console.log(` Plan level: ${userInfo.plan.level || 'Not specified'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check if this is an enterprise account\n        if (userInfo.enterpriseInfo) {\n          console.log(' This is an Enterprise account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' This is not an Enterprise account');\n        }\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error checking API permissions:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        \n        // Display document info if found\n        if (publicDocs.items && publicDocs.items.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== Document List =====');\n          publicDocs.items.forEach((doc, index) => {\n            console.log(`\\nDocument ${index + 1}:`);\n            console.log(`- Name: ${doc.name}`);\n            console.log(`- ID: ${doc.id}`);\n            console.log(`- Created: ${new Date(doc.createdAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n            console.log(`- Modified: ${new Date(doc.modifiedAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n          });\n        } else {\n          console.log('No documents found. This could be normal for a new account.');\n        }\n        \n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        \n        // Enhanced error handling\n        if (error.response) {\n          console.log(`Status code: ${error.response.status}`);\n          \n          if (error.response.status === 401) {\n            console.log(' Permission issue detected: 401 Unauthorized');\n            console.log('   This API key may not have document read permissions');\n            console.log('   For an API key, check that it was created with OAuth2Read scope');\n            console.log('   For OAuth tokens, check that the token has correct permissions');\n            \n            // Try to get session info to check scopes\n            try {\n              const userInfo = await auth.get('/users/sessioninfo');\n              if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n                const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n                console.log('\\nScope analysis:');\n                for (const [scope, enabled] of Object.entries(scopeAnalysis)) {\n                  console.log(`- ${scope}: ${enabled ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled'}`);\n                }\n                \n                if (!scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Read) {\n                  console.log('\\n OAuth2Read scope is missing. This is required for document access.');\n                }\n              }\n            } catch (sessionError) {\n              console.log('Could not retrieve session info for scope analysis.');\n            }\n          }\n        }\n        \n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  describe('SimpleRestApi Tests', () => {\n    let api;\n    \n    beforeAll(() => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      api = new SimpleRestApi({\n        authType: authType,\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    });\n    \n    test('should get user profile info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should get user profile info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await api.request('get', path);\n        console.log(' Success! User profile info retrieved');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name || 'Not provided');\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error getting user profile info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should search for my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should search for my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const searchResults = await api.request('get', path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${searchResults.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(searchResults).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(searchResults.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error searching for documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n});\n```\n\nKey changes:\n\n1. Added a new `analyzeOAuth2Scopes` function that interprets the numeric oauth2Scopes value as bitwise flags\n2. Updated the session info test to handle both numeric and array forms of oauth2Scopes\n3. Added display of user roles from the API response\n4. Updated the permissions check to correctly interpret the numeric scope value\n5. Enhanced error handling for the document access test to provide more detailed diagnosis\n6. Added planGroup field support which appears in the API response\n\nThe issue is likely that the oauth2Scopes value 4103 needs to be interpreted as bitwise flags rather than as an array of string scopes.",

              "code": "/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    process.stdout.write('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\n// Helper function to analyze OAuth2 scope bitwise value\nfunction analyzeOAuth2Scopes(scopeValue) {\n  // Common OAuth2 scope bit values\n  const scopeBits = {\n    OAuth2Read: 1,        // 2^0 = 1\n    OAuth2Write: 2,       // 2^1 = 2\n    OAuth2Delete: 4,      // 2^2 = 4\n    OAuth2ReadPII: 8      // 2^3 = 8\n    // There are more scopes but these are the common ones\n  };\n\n This could be normal for a new account.');\n        }\n        \n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        \n        // Enhanced error handling\n        if (error.response) {\n          console.log(`Status code: ${error.response.status}`);\n          \n          if (error.response.status === 401) {\n            console.log(' Permission issue detected: 401 Unauthorized');\n            console.log('   This API key may not have document read permissions');\n            console.log('   For an API key, check that it was created with OAuth2Read scope');\n            console.log('   For OAuth tokens, check that the token has correct permissions');\n            \n            // Try to get session info to check scopes\n            try {\n              const userInfo = await auth.get('/users/sessioninfo');\n              if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n                const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n                console.log('\\nScope analysis:');\n                for (const [scope, enabled] of Object.entries(scopeAnalysis)) {\n                  console.log(`- ${scope}: ${enabled ?               "content": "This is the response I get from Onshapes Glassworks explorer for the API keys\r\ncurl -X 'GET' \\\r\n  'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10/users/sessioninfo' \\\r\n  -H 'accept: application/json;charset=UTF-8; qs=0.09' \\\r\n  -H 'Authorization: Basic dkhWbEhnQkQzY1hZbFpVYk5zT0sxWXp5OllHcTVINFBPSVgwS1pWbXJScDVDTHN5ZUZPRFc5NW5xUzR4Zmpqd1dpdGZQZkpHQw==' \\\r\n  -H 'X-XSRF-TOKEN: 0Nh/lkNxWdMVlFuVFyn++A=='\r\n  \r\n{\r\n  \"jsonType\": \"BTUserOAuth2SummaryInfo\",\r\n  \"oauth2Scopes\": 4103,\r\n  \"planGroup\": \"Free\",\r\n  \"roles\": [\r\n    \"USER\",\r\n    \"DEVELOPER\"\r\n  ],\r\n  \"companyPlan\": false,\r\n  \"clientId\": null,\r\n  \"role\": 0,\r\n  \"source\": 1,\r\n  \"isGuest\": false,\r\n  \"isLight\": false,\r\n  \"personalMessageAllowed\": false,\r\n  \"invitationState\": 0,\r\n  \"company\": null,\r\n  \"globalPermissions\": null,\r\n  \"lastLoginTime\": \"2025-03-13T01:34:37.147+00:00\",\r\n  \"documentationNameOverride\": null,\r\n  \"firstName\": \"Karl\",\r\n  \"lastName\": \"Mochel\",\r\n  \"email\": \"kalmdown@gmail.com\",\r\n  \"documentationName\": null,\r\n  \"state\": 1,\r\n  \"isOnshapeSupport\": false,\r\n  \"image\": \"https://profiles.onshape.com/e47beddcd5ae61df546727d0dd05c7729d54253111374a8155b289f3351e7ae8.png\",\r\n  \"name\": \"kalmdown\",\r\n  \"id\": \"603eb0aa699e5e148e310edc\",\r\n  \"href\": \"https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10/users/603eb0aa699e5e148e310edc\"\r\n}\r\nDOes it offer any clues why this code does not work"
