            {
              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "After examining the Onshape API response, I can see several key issues with the current test code:\n\n1. The API response structure is different than what our code expects:\n   - `oauth2Scopes` is a number (4103), not an array of strings\n   - The user does have a name (\"kalmdown\"), but the test output shows \"undefined\"\n\n2. The document access error (401 Unauthorized) likely relates to how we're interpreting the permissions.\n\nHere's a list of updates to fix these issues in the `free-account.integration.test.js` file:\n\n1. Update session info test to handle numeric oauth2Scopes\n2. Fix user name handling\n3. Add bitwise scope checking for permissions\n4. Improve error handling for document access\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\free-account.integration.test.js\n/**\n * Test script specifically designed for free Onshape accounts\n * Focuses on using public document features that are more accessible\n */\n// Load environment variables with absolute path\nconst path = require('path');\nconst childProcess = require('child_process');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\nconst OnshapeAuth = require('../src/auth/onshape-auth');\nconst AuthManager = require('../src/auth/auth-manager');\nconst SimpleRestApi = require('../src/api/simple-rest-api');\nconst logger = require('../src/utils/logger');\n\n// Set log level\nlogger.logLevel = 'debug';\n\n/**\n * Clear the terminal in a cross-platform way\n */\nfunction clearTerminal() {\n  try {\n    // For Windows\n    if (process.platform === 'win32') {\n      childProcess.execSync('cls', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    } \n    // For Unix-based systems (Linux, macOS)\n    else {\n      childProcess.execSync('clear', { stdio: 'inherit' });\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    // If clearing fails, just print a separator line\n    process.stdout.write('\\n\\n' + '='.repeat(80) + '\\n\\n');\n  }\n}\n\n// Helper function to format the log output\nfunction formatLog(testName, method, fullUrl, queryParams = null, payload = null) {\n  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/T/, ' ').replace(/\\..+/, '');\n  let log = `[${timestamp}] TEST: ${testName}\\n`;\n  log += `  ${method} ${fullUrl}\\n`;\n  if (queryParams) {\n    log += `  QUERY PARAMS: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  if (payload) {\n    log += `  PAYLOAD: ${JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2)}\\n`;\n  }\n  log += '--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n';\n  return log;\n}\n\n// Helper function to analyze OAuth2 scope bitwise value\nfunction analyzeOAuth2Scopes(scopeValue) {\n  // Common OAuth2 scope bit values\n  const scopeBits = {\n    OAuth2Read: 1,        // 2^0 = 1\n    OAuth2Write: 2,       // 2^1 = 2\n    OAuth2Delete: 4,      // 2^2 = 4\n    OAuth2ReadPII: 8      // 2^3 = 8\n    // There are more scopes but these are the common ones\n  };\n\n  const results = {};\n  for (const [scopeName, bitValue] of Object.entries(scopeBits)) {\n    results[scopeName] = Boolean(scopeValue & bitValue);\n  }\n  return results;\n}\n\ndescribe('Free Onshape Account API Integration', () => {\n  // Check for required credentials before tests\n  let hasCredentials = true;\n  let auth;\n  let authType;\n  let baseUrl = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v10';\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    // Clear terminal at the beginning of the test run\n    clearTerminal();\n    \n    // Check credentials\n    if (!process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY || !process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Parse authentication type from environment\n    authType = process.env.ONSHAPE_AUTH_METHOD || 'api_key';\n    \n    if (!['api_key', 'oauth'].includes(authType.toLowerCase())) {\n      console.warn(' WARNING: Invalid auth type. Tests will be skipped.');\n      hasCredentials = false;\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log(`Using authentication type: ${authType}`);\n    \n    // Initialize auth client\n    if (authType.toLowerCase() === 'api_key') {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    } else {\n      auth = new OnshapeAuth({\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    }\n  });\n  \n  describe('Direct OnshapeAuth Tests', () => {\n    test('should retrieve user session info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should retrieve user session info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        console.log(' Success! User info retrieved');\n        \n        // Display relevant user information\n        console.log('\\n===== User Profile Information =====');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User ID:', userInfo.id || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('User Type:', userInfo.type || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Email:', userInfo.email || 'Not provided');\n        console.log('Plan Name:', userInfo.planGroup || userInfo.plan?.name || 'Not provided');\n        \n        // Display OAuth scopes\n        console.log('\\n===== OAuth Scopes =====');\n        if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          console.log('OAuth2 Scope Value (bitwise):', userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n          const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n          for (const [scope, enabled] of Object.entries(scopeAnalysis)) {\n            console.log(`- ${scope}: ${enabled ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled'}`);\n          }\n        } else if (Array.isArray(userInfo.oauth2Scopes) && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          userInfo.oauth2Scopes.forEach(scope => {\n            console.log(`- ${scope}`);\n          });\n        } else {\n          console.log('No OAuth scopes found or scope format is unexpected');\n        }\n        \n        // Display roles if available\n        if (userInfo.roles && userInfo.roles.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== User Roles =====');\n          userInfo.roles.forEach(role => {\n            console.log(`- ${role}`);\n          });\n        }\n        \n        // Display complete user object for debugging\n        console.log('\\n===== Complete User Object =====');\n        console.log(JSON.stringify(userInfo, null, 2));\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error retrieving user info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n\n    test('should check API permissions', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should check API permissions';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await auth.get(path);\n        \n        console.log('\\n===== API Key Permissions Analysis =====');\n        \n        // Check if user has a name - might indicate a properly configured user account\n        if (userInfo.name) {\n          console.log(' API key is associated with a named user account:', userInfo.name);\n        } else {\n          console.log(' API key may not be associated with a fully configured user account');\n        }\n        \n        // Check for document access permissions\n        let hasReadAccess = false;\n        let hasWriteAccess = false;\n        \n        if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n          hasReadAccess = scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Read;\n          hasWriteAccess = scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Write;\n          \n          console.log('OAuth2 Scope Value:', userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n        } else if (Array.isArray(userInfo.oauth2Scopes) && userInfo.oauth2Scopes.length > 0) {\n          hasReadAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Read') || scope.includes('read'));\n          hasWriteAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n            scope.includes('OAuth2Write') || scope.includes('write'));\n        }\n        \n        console.log(` Read access: ${hasReadAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n        console.log(` Write access: ${hasWriteAccess ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n        \n        if (!hasReadAccess) {\n          console.log(' This API key does not have document read permissions');\n          console.log('   Add \"OAuth2Read\" scope to enable document access');\n        }\n        \n        // Check user roles\n        if (userInfo.roles && userInfo.roles.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n User Roles:');\n          userInfo.roles.forEach(role => {\n            console.log(`   - ${role}`);\n          });\n          \n          const isDeveloper = userInfo.roles.includes('DEVELOPER');\n          console.log(` Developer role: ${isDeveloper ? 'YES' : 'NO'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check plan limitations\n        if (userInfo.planGroup) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.planGroup}`);\n        } else if (userInfo.plan) {\n          console.log(` Account plan: ${userInfo.plan.name}`);\n          console.log(` Plan level: ${userInfo.plan.level || 'Not specified'}`);\n        }\n        \n        // Check if this is an enterprise account\n        if (userInfo.enterpriseInfo) {\n          console.log(' This is an Enterprise account');\n        } else {\n          console.log(' This is not an Enterprise account');\n        }\n        \n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error checking API permissions:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should find my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should find my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${publicDocs.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        \n        // Display document info if found\n        if (publicDocs.items && publicDocs.items.length > 0) {\n          console.log('\\n===== Document List =====');\n          publicDocs.items.forEach((doc, index) => {\n            console.log(`\\nDocument ${index + 1}:`);\n            console.log(`- Name: ${doc.name}`);\n            console.log(`- ID: ${doc.id}`);\n            console.log(`- Created: ${new Date(doc.createdAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n            console.log(`- Modified: ${new Date(doc.modifiedAt).toLocaleString()}`);\n          });\n        } else {\n          console.log('No documents found. This could be normal for a new account.');\n        }\n        \n        expect(publicDocs).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(publicDocs.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error finding documents:', error.message);\n        \n        // Enhanced error handling\n        if (error.response) {\n          console.log(`Status code: ${error.response.status}`);\n          \n          if (error.response.status === 401) {\n            console.log(' Permission issue detected: 401 Unauthorized');\n            console.log('   This API key may not have document read permissions');\n            console.log('   For an API key, check that it was created with OAuth2Read scope');\n            console.log('   For OAuth tokens, check that the token has correct permissions');\n            \n            // Try to get session info to check scopes\n            try {\n              const userInfo = await auth.get('/users/sessioninfo');\n              if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n                const scopeAnalysis = analyzeOAuth2Scopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n                console.log('\\nScope analysis:');\n                for (const [scope, enabled] of Object.entries(scopeAnalysis)) {\n                  console.log(`- ${scope}: ${enabled ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled'}`);\n                }\n                \n                if (!scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Read) {\n                  console.log('\\n OAuth2Read scope is missing. This is required for document access.');\n                }\n              }\n            } catch (sessionError) {\n              console.log('Could not retrieve session info for scope analysis.');\n            }\n          }\n        }\n        \n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n  \n  describe('SimpleRestApi Tests', () => {\n    let api;\n    \n    beforeAll(() => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      api = new SimpleRestApi({\n        authType: authType,\n        accessKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY,\n        secretKey: process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY,\n        oauthToken: process.env.ONSHAPE_OAUTH_TOKEN,\n        baseUrl: baseUrl\n      });\n    });\n    \n    test('should get user profile info', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/users/sessioninfo`;\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}`;\n      const testName = 'should get user profile info';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl));\n      try {\n        const userInfo = await api.request('get', path);\n        console.log(' Success! User profile info retrieved');\n        console.log('User Name:', userInfo.name || 'Not provided');\n        expect(userInfo).toBeDefined();\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error getting user profile info:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n    \n    test('should search for my documents', async () => {\n      if (!hasCredentials) return;\n      const path = `/documents`;\n      const queryParams = { filter: 0, ownerType: 1, sortColumn: 'createdAt', sortOrder: 'desc', offset: 0, limit: 20 };\n      const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${path}?${new URLSearchParams(queryParams).toString()}`;\n      const testName = 'should search for my documents';\n      console.log(formatLog(testName, 'GET', fullUrl, queryParams));\n      try {\n        const searchResults = await api.request('get', path, queryParams);\n        console.log(` Success! Found ${searchResults.items?.length || 0} documents`);\n        expect(searchResults).toBeDefined();\n        expect(Array.isArray(searchResults.items)).toBe(true);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(' Error searching for documents:', error.message);\n        throw error;\n      }\n    });\n  });\n});\n```\n\nKey changes:\n\n1. Added a new `analyzeOAuth2Scopes` function that interprets the numeric oauth2Scopes value as bitwise flags\n2. Updated the session info test to handle both numeric and array forms of oauth2Scopes\n3. Added display of user roles from the API response\n4. Updated the permissions check to correctly interpret the numeric scope value\n5. Enhanced error handling for the document access test to provide more detailed diagnosis\n6. Added planGroup field support which appears in the API response\n\nThe issue is likely that the oauth2Scopes value 4103 needs to be interpreted as bitwise flags rather than as an array of string scopes."

OAuth2 scope bit values\n  // These values are based on Onshape's actual bit mapping\n  const scopeBits = {\n    OAuth2Read: 1,        // 2^0 = 1\n    OAuth2Write: 2,       // 2^1 = 2\n    OAuth2Delete: 4,      // 2^2 = 4\n    OAuth2ReadPII: 8,     // 2^3 = 8\n    OAuth2Export: 16,     // 2^4 = 16\n    OAuth2Purchase: 32,   // 2^5 = 32\n    // The value 4103 suggests there are higher-order bits set\n    // Let's include all known bits and some additional ones that might be set\n    OAuth2Company: 64,    // 2^6 = 64\n    OAuth2Admin: 128,     // 2^7 = 128\n    OAuth2Enterprise: 256 // 2^8 = 256\n    // Bit 12 (2^12 = 4096) appears to be set in 4103\n  };\n\n  const results = {};\n  for (const [scopeName, bitValue] of Object.entries(scopeBits)) {\n    results[scopeName] = Boolean(scopeValue & bitValue);\n  }\n  \n  // Debug: output the binary representation of the scope value\n  results.binaryRepresentation = scopeValue.toString(2);\n  \n  return results;\n}\n\n// In the document access test function, add this code before the API call:\ntest('should find my documents', async () => {\n  if (!hasCredentials) return;\n  const path = info to check scopes\n    const sessionInfo = await auth.get('/users/sessioninfo');\n    console.log('Session info retrieved, checking permissions...');\n    \n    if (typeof sessionInfo.oauth2Scopes console.log('OAuth2Read permission:', scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Read ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled');\n      console.log('OAuth2Write permission:', scopeAnalysis.OAuth2Write ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled');\n    }\n    \n    // Now try to get the documents\n    const publicDocs = await auth.get(path, queryParams);\n    // Rest of the existing code...\n  } catch (error) {\n    // Existing error handling...\n  }\n});\n```\n\nThe main issue appears to be with the authentication. This file will include hardcoded API calls for authentication, getting session info, listing documents, creating a document, and deleting a document.\n\nHere's a list of updates:\n\n* `tests/direct-api-calls.test.js`: Create a new test file with hardcoded API calls\n\n```javascript\n",
          "supportThemeIcons": false,
          "supportHtml": false,
          "baseUri": {
            "$mid": 1,
            "path": "/c:/Dev/GitHub-Projects/onjs/",
            "scheme": "file"

        {
          "kind": "codeblockUri",
          "uri": {
            "$mid": 1,
            "external": "file:///c%3A/Dev/GitHub-Projects/onjs/tests/direct-api-calls.test.js",
            "path": "/c:/Dev/GitHub-Projects/onjs/tests/direct-api-calls.test.js",
            "scheme": "file"
          }
        },
        {
          "value": "/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\ndescribe('Direct Onshape API Calls', () => {\n  // Skip if no API credentials\n  let skipTests = false;\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      skipTests = true;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('1. Get session info with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n      console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n      console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('2. Get my documents with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    const queryParams = {\n      filter: 0,\n      ownerType: 1,\n      sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n      sortOrder: 'desc', \n      offset: 0,\n      limit: 20\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    console.log(`Query parameters: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        params: queryParams\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n      console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n      \n      if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n        console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n        console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n        console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n      }\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n      \n      // Store document count for later tests\n      global.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n      \n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('3. Create a public document with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'POST';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    \n    // Hardcoded document creation payload\n    const documentData = {\n      name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n      description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n      isPublic: true,\n      ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n      betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    console.log(`Document data: ${JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2)}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        data: documentData\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      global.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data.id).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('4. Delete the created document with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    // Skip if no document was created\n    if (!global.testDocumentId) {\n      console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    const method = 'DELETE';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${global.testDocumentId}`;\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Document deleted');\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('5. Verify document was deleted', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    const queryParams = {\n      filter: 0,\n      ownerType: 1,\n      sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n      sortOrder: 'desc',\n      offset: 0,\n      limit: 20\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        params: queryParams\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n      \n      const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n      console.log(`Document count before: ${global.existingDocumentCount}`);\n      console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n      \n      // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n      expect(newDocumentCount).toBe(global.existingDocumentCount);\n      \n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n});\n```\n\nThis test file:\n\n1. Implements direct API calls to the Onshape API using axios\n2. Uses hardcoded URLs, methods, and request data\n3. Includes a custom authentication header generator for API key authentication\n4. Tests the full document lifecycle: check session info, list documents, create a document, delete the document, verify deletion\n5. Provides detailed logging of requests and responses\n6. Follows best practices for error handling\n7. Contains no dependencies on existing Onshape client code\n\nTo run this test:\n\n```bash\nnpx jest tests/direct-api-calls.test.js\n```\n\nThe file reads the API credentials from the .env file but does not depend on any existing Onshape client code. Each API call is explicit and self-contained, making it easier to debug authentication or request issues.",

          "codeBlocks": [
            {
              "code": "/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\ndescribe('Direct Onshape API Calls', () => {\n  // Skip if no API credentials\n  let skipTests = false;\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      skipTests = true;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('1. Get session info with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n      console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n      console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('2. Get my documents with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    const queryParams = {\n      filter: 0,\n      ownerType: 1,\n      sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n      sortOrder: 'desc', \n      offset: 0,\n      limit: 20\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    console.log(`Query parameters: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        params: queryParams\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n      console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n      \n      if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n        console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n        console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n        console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n      }\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n      \n      // Store document count for later tests\n      global.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n      \n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('3. Create a public document with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'POST';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    \n    // Hardcoded document creation payload\n    const documentData = {\n      name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n      description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n      isPublic: true,\n      ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n      betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    console.log(`Document data: ${JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2)}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        data: documentData\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      global.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data.id).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('4. Delete the created document with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    // Skip if no document was created\n    if (!global.testDocumentId) {\n      console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    const method = 'DELETE';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${global.testDocumentId}`;\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Document deleted');\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('5. Verify document was deleted', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    const queryParams = {\n      filter: 0,\n      ownerType: 1,\n      sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n      sortOrder: 'desc',\n      offset: 0,\n      limit: 20\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        params: queryParams\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n      \n      const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n      console.log(`Document count before: ${global.existingDocumentCount}`);\n      console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n      \n      // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n      expect(newDocumentCount).toBe(global.existingDocumentCount);\n      \n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n});\n",

            {
              "role": "user",
              "content": "Create a test file that does not use any of the current code. Instead it should have each of the same calls hardcoded (no parts of the call calculated) to login, get sessioninfo, get a list of the users documents, create a pbulic document, delete that document."

            {
              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "Based on your requirements, I'll create a standalone test file that directly calls the Onshape API without using any existing code. This file will include hardcoded API calls for authentication, getting session info, listing documents, creating a document, and deleting a document.\n\nHere's a list of updates:\n\n* [`tests/direct-api-calls.test.js`](tests/direct-api-calls.test.js): Create a new test file with hardcoded API calls\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\direct-api-calls.test.js\n/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\ndescribe('Direct Onshape API Calls', () => {\n  // Skip if no API credentials\n  let skipTests = false;\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      skipTests = true;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('1. Get session info with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n      console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n      console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('2. Get my documents with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    const queryParams = {\n      filter: 0,\n      ownerType: 1,\n      sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n      sortOrder: 'desc', \n      offset: 0,\n      limit: 20\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    console.log(`Query parameters: ${JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2)}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        params: queryParams\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n      console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n      \n      if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n        console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n        console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n        console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n      }\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n      \n      // Store document count for later tests\n      global.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n      \n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('3. Create a public document with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'POST';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    \n    // Hardcoded document creation payload\n    const documentData = {\n      name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n      description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n      isPublic: true,\n      ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n      betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    console.log(`Document data: ${JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2)}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        data: documentData\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      global.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data.id).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('4. Delete the created document with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    // Skip if no document was created\n    if (!global.testDocumentId) {\n      console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    const method = 'DELETE';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${global.testDocumentId}`;\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Document deleted');\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('5. Verify document was deleted', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n    const queryParams = {\n      filter: 0,\n      ownerType: 1,\n      sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n      sortOrder: 'desc',\n      offset: 0,\n      limit: 20\n    };\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers,\n        params: queryParams\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n      \n      const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n      console.log(`Document count before: ${global.existingDocumentCount}`);\n      console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n      \n      // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n      expect(newDocumentCount).toBe(global.existingDocumentCount);\n      \n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n});\n```\n\nThis test file:\n\n1. Implements direct API calls to the Onshape API using axios\n2. Uses hardcoded URLs, methods, and request data\n3. Includes a custom authentication header generator for API key authentication\n4. Tests the full document lifecycle: check session info, list documents, create a document, delete the document, verify deletion\n5. Provides detailed logging of requests and responses\n6. Follows best practices for error handling\n7. Contains no dependencies on existing Onshape client code\n\nTo run this test:\n\n```bash\nnpx jest tests/direct-api-calls.test.js\n```\n\nThe file reads the API credentials from the .env file but does not depend on any existing Onshape client code. Each API call is explicit and self-contained, making it easier to debug authentication or request issues."

        {
          "value": "/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Import Jest functions explicitly\nconst { describe, test, expect, beforeAll } = require('@jest/globals');\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\ndescribe('Direct Onshape API Calls', () => {\n  // Skip if no API credentials\n  let skipTests = false;\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      skipTests = true;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('1. Get session info with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n      console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n      console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  // Rest of the test file remains the same...\n});\n```\n\nTo run this test, you have two options:\n\n1. Use Jest to run the test (preferred):\n```bash\nnpx jest tests/direct-api-calls.test.js\n```\n\n2. If you need to run it directly with Node.js:\n```bash\nnode tests/direct-api-calls.test.js\n```\n\nThe explicit import of Jest functions should allow the file to run either way.",

'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\ndescribe('Direct Onshape API Calls', () => {\n  // Skip if no API credentials\n  let skipTests = false;\n  \n  beforeAll(() => {\n    if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n      console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n      skipTests = true;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  test('1. Get session info with hardcoded call', async () => {\n    if (skipTests) return;\n    \n    const method = 'GET';\n    const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n    const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n    \n    console.log(`\\n Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n    \n    try {\n      // Generate authentication headers\n      const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n      \n      // Make the API call with axios\n      const response = await axios({\n        method: method,\n        url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n        headers: headers\n      });\n      \n      console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n      console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n      console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n      \n      expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n      expect(response.data).toBeDefined();\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n      if (error.response) {\n        console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n        console.error(`Data:`, error.response.data);\n      }\n      throw error;\n    }\n  });\n  \n  // Rest of the test file remains the same...\n});\n```\n\nTo run this test, you have two options:\n\n1.           "value": "/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n// Store global values between API calls\nconst globals = {\n  existingDocumentCount: 0,\n  testDocumentId: null\n};\n\n/**\n * Simple assertion function\n */\nfunction assert(condition, message) {\n  if (!condition) {\n    console.error(` Assertion failed: ${message}`);\n    throw new Error(message);\n  }\n  console.log(` Assertion passed: ${message}`);\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 1: Get session info with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n    console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n    console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n    console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n    \n    if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    // Store document count for later tests\n    globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    \n    return           "value": "/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n// Store global values between API calls\nconst globals = {\n  existingDocumentCount: 0,\n  testDocumentId: null\n};\n\n/**\n * Simple assertion function\n */\nfunction assert(condition, message) {\n  if (!condition) {\n    console.error(` Assertion failed: ${message}`);\n    throw new Error(message);\n  }\n  console.log(` Assertion passed: ${message}`);\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 1: Get session info with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n    console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n    console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n    console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n    \n    if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    // Store document count for later tests\n    globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Document created');\n    console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n    console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n    console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n    \n    // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n    globals.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 4: Delete the created document\n */\nasync function deleteCreatedDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 4: Delete the created document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  // Skip if no document was created\n  if (!globals.testDocumentId) {\n    console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  const method = 'DELETE';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${globals.testDocumentId}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Document deleted');\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 5: Verify document was deleted\n */\nasync function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 5: Verify document was deleted');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc',\n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n    \n    const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    console.log(`Document count before: ${globals.existingDocumentCount}`);\n    console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n    \n    // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n    assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n      `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Execute all tests when run directly\nif (require.main === module) {\n  runAllTests().catch(error => {\n    console.error('Error in test execution:', error);\n    process.exit(1);\n  });\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n```\n\nThis standalone script:\n\n1. Has **NO Jest dependencies** - it runs directly with Node.js\n2. Implements all the API calls with proper error handling\n3. Uses a simple assert function instead of Jest's expect()\n4. Runs the tests in sequence when executed directly\n5. Includes exports so the functions can be used in other files\n\nTo run this file:\n\n```bash\nnode tests/direct-api-calls.js\n```\n\nThis should work without any Jest-related errors since it doesn't rely on any Jest functionality.",
