              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "I see the issue - you're trying to run a Jest test file directly with Node.js, but it contains Jest-specific imports. Let's create a complete standalone version that runs directly with Node.js without any Jest dependencies.\n\nHere's a list of updates to each file:\n\n* [`tests/direct-api-calls.js`](tests/direct-api-calls.js): Complete the missing functions in the standalone script\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\direct-api-calls.js\n/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n// Store global values between API calls\nconst globals = {\n  existingDocumentCount: 0,\n  testDocumentId: null\n};\n\n/**\n * Simple assertion function\n */\nfunction assert(condition, message) {\n  if (!condition) {\n    console.error(` Assertion failed: ${message}`);\n    throw new Error(message);\n  }\n  console.log(` Assertion passed: ${message}`);\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 1: Get session info with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n    console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n    console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n    console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n    \n    if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    // Store document count for later tests\n    globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Document created');\n    console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n    console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n    console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n    \n    // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n    globals.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 4: Delete the created document\n */\nasync function deleteCreatedDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 4: Delete the created document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  // Skip if no document was created\n  if (!globals.testDocumentId) {\n    console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  const method = 'DELETE';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${globals.testDocumentId}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Document deleted');\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 5: Verify document was deleted\n */\nasync function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 5: Verify document was deleted');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc',\n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${baseUrl}${urlPath}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n    \n    const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    console.log(`Document count before: ${globals.existingDocumentCount}`);\n    console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n    \n    // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n    assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n      `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Execute all tests when run directly\nif (require.main === module) {\n  runAllTests().catch(error => {\n    console.error('Error in test execution:', error);\n    process.exit(1);\n  });\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n```\n\nThis standalone script:\n\n1. Has **NO Jest dependencies** - it runs directly with Node.js\n2. Implements all the API calls with proper error handling\n3. Uses a simple assert function instead of Jest's expect()\n4. Runs the tests in sequence when executed directly\n5. Includes exports so the functions can be used in other files\n\nTo run this file:\n\n```bash\nnode tests/direct-api-calls.js\n```\n\nThis should work without any Jest-related errors since it doesn't rely on any Jest functionality."

          "value": "/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n// Store global values between API calls\nconst globals = {\n  existingDocumentCount: 0,\n  testDocumentId: null\n};\n\n/**\n * Simple assertion function\n */\nfunction assert(condition, message) {\n  if (!condition) {\n    console.error(` Assertion failed: ${message}`);\n    throw new Error(message);\n  }\n  console.log(` Assertion passed: ${message}`);\n}\n\n/**\n * Format and print request details\n */\nfunction printRequestDetails(method, url, headers, queryParams = null, data = null) {\n  console.log('\\n REQUEST DETAILS:');\n  console.log(`${method} ${url}`);\n  \n  console.log('\\n Headers:');\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(headers)) {\n    // Mask Authorization header to protect credentials\n    if (key === 'Authorization') {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value.substring(0, 15)}...`);\n    } else {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n    }\n  }\n  \n  if (queryParams && Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0) {\n    console.log('\\n Query Parameters:');\n    console.log(JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  }\n  \n  if (data) {\n    console.log('\\n Request Body:');\n    console.log(JSON.stringify(data, null, 2));\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n}\n\n/**\n * Format and print response details\n */\nfunction printResponseDetails(response) {\n  console.log('\\n RESPONSE DETAILS:');\n  console.log(`Status: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);\n  \n  console.log('\\n Response Headers:');\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(response.headers)) {\n    console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\n Response Body:');\n  console.log(JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2));\n  \n  console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 1: Get session info with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n    console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n    console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n    console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n    \n    if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    // Store document count for later tests\n    globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, null, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Document created');\n    console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n    console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n    console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n    \n    // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n    globals.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 4: Delete the created document\n */\nasync function deleteCreatedDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 4: Delete the created document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  // Skip if no document was created\n  if (!globals.testDocumentId) {\n    console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  const method = 'DELETE';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${globals.testDocumentId}`;\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Document deleted');\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 5: Verify document was deleted\n */\nasync function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 5: Verify document was deleted');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc',\n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n    \n    const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    console.log(`Document count before: ${globals.existingDocumentCount}`);\n    console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n    \n    // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n    assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n      `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Execute all tests when run directly\nif (require.main === module) {\n  runAllTests().catch(error => {\n    console.error('Error in test execution:', error);\n    process.exit(1);\n  });\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n```\n\nThe key additions to the file are:\n\n1. debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n// Store global values between API calls\nconst globals = {\n  existingDocumentCount: 0,\n  testDocumentId: null\n};\n\n/**\n * Simple assertion function\n */\nfunction assert(condition, message) {\n  if 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n    \n    if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    // Store document count for later tests\n    globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, null, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Document created');\n    console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n    console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n    console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n    \n    // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n    globals.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 4: Delete the created document\n */\nasync function deleteCreatedDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 4: Delete the created document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  // Skip if no document was created\n  if (!globals.testDocumentId) {\n    console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  const method = 'DELETE';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${globals.testDocumentId}`;\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Document deleted');\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 5: Verify document was deleted\n */\nasync function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 5: Verify document was deleted');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc',\n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n    \n    const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    console.log(`Document count before: ${globals.existingDocumentCount}`);\n    console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n    \n    // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n    assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n      `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Execute all tests when run directly\nif (require.main === module) {\n  runAllTests().catch(error => {\n    console.error('Error in test execution:', error);\n    process.exit(1);\n  });\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n",

              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "Based on your request, I'll enhance the `direct-api-calls.js` file to print complete request and response details for each API call. This will make it easier to debug API interactions by showing exactly what's being sent and received.\n\nHere's a list of updates to the file:\n\n* [`tests/direct-api-calls.js`](tests/direct-api-calls.js):\n   * Add helper functions to format and print request details\n   * Add helper functions to format and print response details\n   * Update each test function to use these helpers\n   * Maintain existing functionality while adding more detailed logging\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\direct-api-calls.js\n/**\n * Direct Onshape API Test\n * \n * This file contains direct API calls to Onshape without using any wrapper libraries.\n * All calls are hardcoded for clarity and debugging purposes.\n */\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\nconst querystring = require('querystring');\nconst path = require('path');\nrequire('dotenv').config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '.env') });\n\n// Hardcoded API access credentials\nconst ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\nconst SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n\n// Store global values between API calls\nconst globals = {\n  existingDocumentCount: 0,\n  testDocumentId: null\n};\n\n/**\n * Simple assertion function\n */\nfunction assert(condition, message) {\n  if (!condition) {\n    console.error(` Assertion failed: ${message}`);\n    throw new Error(message);\n  }\n  console.log(` Assertion passed: ${message}`);\n}\n\n/**\n * Format and print request details\n */\nfunction printRequestDetails(method, url, headers, queryParams = null, data = null) {\n  console.log('\\n REQUEST DETAILS:');\n  console.log(`${method} ${url}`);\n  \n  console.log('\\n Headers:');\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(headers)) {\n    // Mask Authorization header to protect credentials\n    if (key === 'Authorization') {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value.substring(0, 15)}...`);\n    } else {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n    }\n  }\n  \n  if (queryParams && Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0) {\n    console.log('\\n Query Parameters:');\n    console.log(JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  }\n  \n  if (data) {\n    console.log('\\n Request Body:');\n    console.log(JSON.stringify(data, null, 2));\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n}\n\n/**\n * Format and print response details\n */\nfunction printResponseDetails(response) {\n  console.log('\\n RESPONSE DETAILS:');\n  console.log(`Status: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);\n  \n  console.log('\\n Response Headers:');\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(response.headers)) {\n    console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\n Response Body:');\n  console.log(JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2));\n  \n  console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate the authentication headers for API key-based requests\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams = {}, bodyContent = null) {\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Convert query params to string\n  const queryString = Object.keys(queryParams).length > 0 \n    ? querystring.stringify(queryParams) \n    : '';\n  \n  // Content-Type is needed for requests with a body\n  const contentType = bodyContent ? 'application/json' : '';\n  \n  // Build the string to sign\n  const stringToSign = [\n    method,                        // HTTP method\n    urlPath,                       // URL path\n    queryString,                   // Query string\n    contentType,                   // Content-Type\n    date,                          // Date\n    nonce,                         // Nonce\n    bodyContent ? JSON.stringify(bodyContent) : '' // Request body (JSON string)\n  ].join('\\n').toLowerCase();\n  \n  // Create the signature\n  const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY);\n  hmac.update(stringToSign, 'utf8');\n  const signature = hmac.digest('base64');\n  \n  // Build the Authorization header\n  const authHeader = `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:HmacSHA256:${signature}`;\n  \n  // Return all the headers needed for the request\n  return {\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Content-Type': contentType || 'application/json',\n    'Authorization': authHeader\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 1: Get session info with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n    console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n    console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n    console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\n    \n    if (response.data.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined');\n    \n    // Store document count for later tests\n    globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving documents:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, null, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Document created');\n    console.log(`Name: ${response.data.name}`);\n    console.log(`ID: ${response.data.id}`);\n    console.log(`URL: ${response.data.href}`);\n    \n    // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n    globals.testDocumentId = response.data.id;\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    assert(response.data.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined');\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error creating document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 4: Delete the created document\n */\nasync function deleteCreatedDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 4: Delete the created document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  // Skip if no document was created\n  if (!globals.testDocumentId) {\n    console.log(' Skipping document deletion as no document was created');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  const method = 'DELETE';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = `/api/v10/documents/${globals.testDocumentId}`;\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Document deleted');\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200, 'Status code should be 200');\n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error deleting document:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 5: Verify document was deleted\n */\nasync function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 5: Verify document was deleted');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc',\n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n    \n    const newDocumentCount = response.data.items?.length || 0;\n    console.log(`Document count before: ${globals.existingDocumentCount}`);\n    console.log(`Document count after: ${newDocumentCount}`);\n    \n    // The counts should match if the document was successfully deleted\n    assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n      `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    \n    return response.data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error verifying document deletion:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Execute all tests when run directly\nif (require.main === module) {\n  runAllTests().catch(error => {\n    console.error('Error in test execution:', error);\n    process.exit(1);\n  });\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n```\n\nThe key additions to the file are:\n\n1. Added `printRequestDetails()` function to format and display:\n   - HTTP method and URL\n   - Request headers (with masked Authorization value for security)\n   - Query parameters (if any)\n   - Request body (if any)\n\n2. Added `printResponseDetails()` function to format and display:\n   - Response status code and text\n   - Response headers\n   - Complete response body (formatted JSON)\n\n3. Updated each test function to call these helper functions before and after API calls\n\n4. Added visual separators between request/response sections for better readability\n\nThese changes maintain all the existing functionality while adding detailed request and response information for debugging API interactions."

        "text": "Problem Explanation\r\nStatus Code 204: This status code indicates that the server has successfully fulfilled the request and there is no additional content to send in the response body. This is typical for operations where the response body would be empty, such as when retrieving session information that doesn't require additional data to be returned.\r\n\r\nAssertion Failure: Your code asserts that the status code should be 200 OK, which typically includes a response body. However, since the API returns 204 No Content, this assertion fails.\r\n\r\nSolution\r\nTo resolve this issue, you should adjust your assertion to accept both 200 OK and 204 No Content status codes, depending on the expected behavior of the API endpoint. Here's how you can modify the assertion in your getSessionInfo function:\r\n\r\njavascript\r\nassert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\r\nAdditionally, you might want to handle the case where the response body is empty (as it would be with a 204 No Content response) to avoid attempting to access properties like name, email, or oauth2Scopes which would be undefined:\r\n\r\njavascript\r\nif (response.status === 204) {\r\n  console.log(' Session info retrieved (no content)');\r\n} else if (response.status === 200) {\r\n  console.log(' Session info retrieved');\r\n  console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\r\n  console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\r\n  console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\r\n}\r\nThis way, your code will correctly handle both scenarios and avoid assertion failures due to the expected status code mismatch.",

document deletion due to 204 response');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n      \n      const newDocumentCount = response.data?.items?.length || 0;\n successfully deleted\n      assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n        `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    }\n    \n successfully deleted\n      assert(newDocumentCount === globals.existingDocumentCount, \n        `Document count should match (${globals.existingDocumentCount})`);\n    }\n    \n               "role": "user",
              "content": "Problem Explanation\r\nStatus Code 204: This status code indicates that the server has successfully fulfilled the request and there is no additional content to send in the response body. This is typical for operations where the response body would be empty, such as when retrieving session information that doesn't require additional data to be returned.\r\n\r\nAssertion Failure: Your code asserts that the status code should be 200 OK, which typically includes a response body. However, since the API returns 204 No Content, this assertion fails.\r\n\r\nSolution\r\nTo resolve this issue, you should adjust your assertion to accept both 200 OK and 204 No Content status codes, depending on the expected behavior of the API endpoint. Here's how you can modify the assertion in your getSessionInfo function:\r\n\r\njavascript\r\nassert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\r\nAdditionally, you might want to handle the case where the response body is empty (as it would be with a 204 No Content response) to avoid attempting to access properties like name, email, or oauth2Scopes which would be undefined:\r\n\r\njavascript\r\nif (response.status === 204) {\r\n  console.log(' Session info retrieved (no content)');\r\n} else if (response.status === 200) {\r\n  console.log(' Session info retrieved');\r\n  console.log(`User: ${response.data.name || 'Name not available'}`);\r\n  console.log(`Email: ${response.data.email || 'Email not available'}`);\r\n  console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data.oauth2Scopes}`);\r\n}\r\nThis way, your code will correctly handle both scenarios and avoid assertion failures due to the expected status code mismatch."

*/\nfunction printResponseDetails(response) {\n  console.log('\\n RESPONSE DETAILS:');\n  console.log(`Status: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);\n  \n  console.log('\\n Response Headers:');\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(response.headers)) {\n    console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\n Response Body:');\n  if (response.status === 204) {\n    console.log('No content (empty response body)');\n  } else if (response.data) {\n    console.log(JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2));\n  } else {\n    console.log('Empty or undefined response body');\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n}\n```\n\nNow I'll update the assertion checks in each API call function to properly handle 204 responses:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\direct-api-calls.js\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 1: Get session info with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Session info retrieved (no content)');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Session info retrieved');\n      // Use optional chaining and nullish coalescing for safety\n      console.log(`User: ${response.data?.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`Email: ${response.data?.email || 'Email not available'}`);\n      console.log(`OAuth2 Scopes: ${response.data?.oauth2Scopes || 'None specified'}`);\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n      assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined for 200 status');\n    }\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Error retrieving session info:', error.message);\n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Data:', error.response.data);\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n```\n\nLet's retrieved');\n      console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data?.items?.length || 0}`);\n      \n      if (response.data?.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n        console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n        console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n        console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n      }\n      \n      // Store document count for later tests\n      globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data?.items?.length || 0;\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if returned)');\n      console.log(' Unable to retrieve document ID from response. Document deletion may fail.');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data?.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data?.id || 'ID not available'}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data?.href || 'URL not available'}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      globals.testDocumentId = response.data?.id;\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  // Existing code...\n  \n  try {\n    // Existing code...\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification (no content)');\n      console.log('Document count before:', document deletion due to 204 response');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved for verification');\n      \n      const newDocumentCount = response.data?.items?.length || 0;\n             "path": "/c:/Dev/GitHub-Projects/onjs/tests/direct-api-calls.js",

        {
          "value": "/**\n * Helper function to interpret OAuth scopes from response\n * Handles both numeric and space-separated string formats\n */\nfunction interpretOAuthScopes(scopeValue) {\n  // If the scope is a number, interpret it as bitwise flags\n  if (typeof scopeValue === 'number') {\n    const scopes = [];\n    const mappings = {\n      1: 'OAuth2Read',\n      2: 'OAuth2Write',\n      4: 'OAuth2Delete',\n      8: 'OAuth2ReadPII'\n      // Additional scope values can be added here\n    };\n    \n    Object.entries(mappings).forEach(([bitValue, scopeName]) => {\n      if (scopeValue & parseInt(bitValue)) {\n        scopes.push(scopeName);\n      }\n    });\n    \n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      binaryValue: scopeValue.toString(2),\n      interpretedScopes: scopes,\n      formatted: scopes.join(' ')\n    };\n  } \n  // If the scope is a string, split it into array\n  else if (typeof scopeValue === 'string') {\n    const scopes = scopeValue.split(' ').filter(s => s);\n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      interpretedScopes: scopes,\n      formatted: scopeValue\n    };\n  }\n  // If the scope is an array, just return it\n  else if (Array.isArray(scopeValue)) {\n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      interpretedScopes: scopeValue,\n      formatted: scopeValue.join(' ')\n    };\n  }\n  \n  return {\n    rawValue: scopeValue,\n    interpretedScopes: [],\n    formatted: 'Unknown format'\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 0: Explicitly test authentication\n */\nasync function testAuthentication() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 0: Authenticate with Onshape API');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making authentication test call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details with special focus on auth headers\n    console.log('\\n AUTHENTICATION REQUEST:');\n    console.log(`${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n    \n    console.log('\\n Authentication Headers:');\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(headers)) {\n      if (key === 'Authorization') {\n        // Show more details of the auth header but still mask sensitive parts\n        const parts = value.split(':');\n        console.log(`${key}: ${parts[0]}:${parts[1]}:****`);\n        console.log(`  - Auth Method: ${parts[0]}`);\n        console.log(`  - Access Key: ${ACCESS_KEY.substring(0, 5)}...${ACCESS_KEY.substring(ACCESS_KEY.length - 5)}`);\n        console.log(`  - Signature Method: ${parts[1]}`);\n      } else {\n        console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    console.log('\\n AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE:');\n    console.log(`Status: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);\n    \n    console.log('\\n Response Headers:');\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(response.headers)) {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n Authentication Response Body:');\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log('No content (empty response body)');\n    } else if (response.data) {\n      console.log(JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2));\n      \n      // Extract and interpret OAuth scopes\n      if (response.data.oauth2Scopes !== undefined) {\n        const scopeInfo = interpretOAuthScopes(response.data.oauth2Scopes);\n        \n        console.log('\\n OAuth Scope Analysis:');\n        console.log(`Raw scope value: ${scopeInfo.rawValue}`);\n        if (typeof response.data.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          console.log(`Binary representation: ${scopeInfo.binaryValue}`);\n        }\n        console.log(`Interpreted scopes: ${JSON.stringify(scopeInfo.interpretedScopes)}`);\n        console.log(`Formatted scope string: ${scopeInfo.formatted}`);\n        \n        // Check for common permissions\n        const hasRead = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Read'));\n        const hasWrite = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Write'));\n        const hasReadPII = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('ReadPII'));\n        const hasDelete = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Delete'));\n        \n        console.log('\\n Permission Summary:');\n        console.log(`Read access: ${hasRead ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`Write access: ${hasWrite ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`PII access: ${hasReadPII ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`Delete access: ${hasDelete ? '' : ''}`);\n      }\n    } else {\n      console.log('Empty or undefined response body');\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n    \n    console.log(' Authentication test successful');\n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Authentication failed:', error.message);\n    console.log('\\n Authentication Error Analysis:');\n    \n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Response data:', error.response.data);\n      \n      // Provide helpful guidance based on status codes\n      if (error.response.status === 401) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Invalid API key or secret');\n        console.log('   - Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n        console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Insufficient permissions');\n        console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n        console.log('   - Request OAuth2Read OAuth2ReadPII scopes at minimum');\n      } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Rate limiting');\n        console.log('   - Too many requests in a short period');\n        console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      }\n    } else if (error.request) {\n      console.error('No response received from server');\n      console.log(' Likely cause: Network issue or incorrect API endpoint');\n      console.log('   - Check your internet connection');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API URL is correct');\n    } else {\n      console.error('Error setting up the request:', error.message);\n    }\n    \n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await testAuthentication();  // Add this line to run the authentication test first\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n// Don't forget to also update the module exports at the end of the file\nmodule.exports = {\n  testAuthentication,  // Add this line\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n```\n\nThis update adds a dedicated authentication test that:\n\n1. Makes an explicit authentication request to Onshape API using the API key method\n2. Shows detailed information about the authentication headers\n3. Analyzes and interprets the OAuth scope values from the response\n4. Provides a permission summary based on the scopes\n5. Includes helpful error diagnostics for common authentication problems\n6. Maintains the existing code style and approach\n7. Handles both numeric and string-based OAuth scope formats\n\nThe test is run first in the sequence to verify authentication before attempting other operations. The function uses the same underlying authentication mechanism but provides more detailed output about the authentication process itself.",

            {
              "code": "/**\n * Helper function to interpret OAuth scopes from response\n * Handles both numeric and space-separated string formats\n */\nfunction interpretOAuthScopes(scopeValue) {\n  // If the scope is a number, interpret it as bitwise flags\n  if (typeof scopeValue === 'number') {\n    const scopes = [];\n    const mappings = {\n      1: 'OAuth2Read',\n      2: 'OAuth2Write',\n      4: 'OAuth2Delete',\n      8: 'OAuth2ReadPII'\n      // Additional scope values can be added here\n    };\n    \n    Object.entries(mappings).forEach(([bitValue, scopeName]) => {\n      if (scopeValue & parseInt(bitValue)) {\n        scopes.push(scopeName);\n      }\n    });\n    \n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      binaryValue: scopeValue.toString(2),\n      interpretedScopes: scopes,\n      formatted: scopes.join(' ')\n    };\n  } \n  // If the scope is a string, split it into array\n  else if (typeof scopeValue === 'string') {\n    const scopes = scopeValue.split(' ').filter(s => s);\n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      interpretedScopes: scopes,\n      formatted: scopeValue\n    };\n  }\n  // If the scope is an array, just return it\n  else if (Array.isArray(scopeValue)) {\n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      interpretedScopes: scopeValue,\n      formatted: scopeValue.join(' ')\n    };\n  }\n  \n  return {\n    rawValue: scopeValue,\n    interpretedScopes: [],\n    formatted: 'Unknown format'\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 0: Explicitly test authentication\n */\nasync function testAuthentication() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 0: Authenticate with Onshape API');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/users/sessioninfo';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making authentication test call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details with special focus on auth headers\n    console.log('\\n AUTHENTICATION REQUEST:');\n    console.log(`${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n    \n    console.log('\\n Authentication Headers:');\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(headers)) {\n      if (key === 'Authorization') {\n        // Show more details of the auth header but still mask sensitive parts\n        const parts = value.split(':');\n        console.log(`${key}: ${parts[0]}:${parts[1]}:****`);\n        console.log(`  - Auth Method: ${parts[0]}`);\n        console.log(`  - Access Key: ${ACCESS_KEY.substring(0, 5)}...${ACCESS_KEY.substring(ACCESS_KEY.length - 5)}`);\n        console.log(`  - Signature Method: ${parts[1]}`);\n      } else {\n        console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    console.log('\\n AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE:');\n    console.log(`Status: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);\n    \n    console.log('\\n Response Headers:');\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(response.headers)) {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n Authentication Response Body:');\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log('No content (empty response body)');\n    } else if (response.data) {\n      console.log(JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2));\n      \n      // Extract and interpret OAuth scopes\n      if (response.data.oauth2Scopes !== undefined) {\n        const scopeInfo = interpretOAuthScopes(response.data.oauth2Scopes);\n        \n        console.log('\\n OAuth Scope Analysis:');\n        console.log(`Raw scope value: ${scopeInfo.rawValue}`);\n        if (typeof response.data.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          console.log(`Binary representation: ${scopeInfo.binaryValue}`);\n        }\n        console.log(`Interpreted scopes: ${JSON.stringify(scopeInfo.interpretedScopes)}`);\n        console.log(`Formatted scope string: ${scopeInfo.formatted}`);\n        \n        // Check for common permissions\n        const hasRead = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Read'));\n        const hasWrite = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Write'));\n        const hasReadPII = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('ReadPII'));\n        const hasDelete = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Delete'));\n        \n        console.log('\\n Permission Summary:');\n        console.log(`Read access: ${hasRead ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`Write access: ${hasWrite ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`PII access: ${hasReadPII ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`Delete access: ${hasDelete ? '' : ''}`);\n      }\n    } else {\n      console.log('Empty or undefined response body');\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n    \n    console.log(' Authentication test successful');\n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Authentication failed:', error.message);\n    console.log('\\n Authentication Error Analysis:');\n    \n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Response data:', error.response.data);\n      \n      // Provide helpful guidance based on status codes\n      if (error.response.status === 401) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Invalid API key or secret');\n        console.log('   - Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n        console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Insufficient permissions');\n        console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n        console.log('   - Request OAuth2Read OAuth2ReadPII scopes at minimum');\n      } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Rate limiting');\n        console.log('   - Too many requests in a short period');\n        console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      }\n    } else if (error.request) {\n      console.error('No response received from server');\n      console.log(' Likely cause: Network issue or incorrect API endpoint');\n      console.log('   - Check your internet connection');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API URL is correct');\n    } else {\n      console.error('Error setting up the request:', error.message);\n    }\n    \n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await testAuthentication();  // Add this line to run the authentication test first\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n// Don't forget to also update the module exports at the end of the file\nmodule.exports = {\n  testAuthentication,  // Add this line\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n",

interpretOAuthScopes(scopeValue) {\n  // If the scope is a number, interpret it as bitwise flags\n  if (typeof scopeValue === 'number') {\n    const scopes = [];\n    const mappings = {\n      1: 'OAuth2Read',\n      2: 'OAuth2Write',\n      4: 'OAuth2Delete',\n      8: 'OAuth2ReadPII'\n      // Additional scope values can be added here\n    };\n    \n scopeValue,\n      binaryValue: scopeValue.toString(2),\n      interpretedScopes: scopes,\n      formatted: scopes.join(' ')\n    };\n  } \n  // If the scope is a string, split it into array\n  else scopeValue\n    };\n  }\n  // If the scope is an array, just return it\n  else if (Array.isArray(scopeValue)) {\n    return {\n      rawValue: scopeValue,\n      interpretedScopes: scopeValue,\n      formatted: scopeValue.join(' ')\n    };\n  }\n  \n  return {\n    rawValue: scopeValue,\n    interpretedScopes: [],\n    formatted: 'Unknown format'\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 0: Explicitly test authentication\n */\nasync function testAuthentication() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 0: Authenticate with Onshape API');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath);\n    \n    // Print request details with special focus on auth headers\n    console.log('\\n AUTHENTICATION REQUEST:');\n    console.log(`${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n    \n    console.log('\\n Authentication Headers:');\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(headers)) {\n      if (key === 'Authorization') {\n        // Show more details of the auth header but still mask sensitive parts\n        const parts = value.split(':');\n        console.log(`${key}: ${parts[0]}:${parts[1]}:****`);\n        console.log(`  - Auth Method: ${parts[0]}`);\n        console.log(`  - Access Key: ${ACCESS_KEY.substring(0, 5)}...${ACCESS_KEY.substring(ACCESS_KEY.length - 5)}`);\n        console.log(`  - Signature Method: ${parts[1]}`);\n      } else {\n        console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    console.log('\\n AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE:');\n    console.log(`Status: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);\n    \n    console.log('\\n Response Headers:');\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(response.headers)) {\n      console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n Authentication Response Body:');\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log('No content (empty response body)');\n    } else if (response.data) {\n      console.log(JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2));\n      \n      // Extract and interpret OAuth scopes\n console.log(`Raw scope value: ${scopeInfo.rawValue}`);\n        if (typeof response.data.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n          console.log(`Binary representation: ${scopeInfo.binaryValue}`);\n        }\n        console.log(`Interpreted scopes: ${JSON.stringify(scopeInfo.interpretedScopes)}`);\n        console.log(`Formatted scope string: ${scopeInfo.formatted}`);\n        \n        // Check for common permissions\n        const hasRead = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Read'));\n        const hasWrite = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Write'));\n        const hasReadPII = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('ReadPII'));\n        const hasDelete = scopeInfo.interpretedScopes.some(s => s.includes('Delete'));\n        \n        console.log('\\n Permission Summary:');\n        console.log(`Read access: ${hasRead ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`Write access: ${hasWrite ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`PII access: ${hasReadPII ? '' : ''}`);\n        console.log(`Delete access: ${hasDelete ? '' : ''}`);\n      }\n    } else {\n      console.log('Empty or undefined response body');\n    }\n    \n    console.log('\\n' + '-'.repeat(80));\n    \n    console.log(' Authentication test successful');\n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(' Authentication failed:', error.message);\n    console.log('\\n Authentication Error Analysis:');\n    \n    if (error.response) {\n      console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n      console.error('Response data:', error.response.data);\n      \n      // Provide helpful guidance based on status codes\n      if (error.response.status === 401) {\n        console.log(' Likely cause: Invalid API key or secret');\n        console.log('   - Too many requests in a short period');\n        console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      }\n    } else if (error.request) {\n      console.error('No response received from server');\n      console.log(' Likely cause: Network issue or incorrect API endpoint');\n      console.log('   -
