          "value": "/**\n * Common authentication error handler\n * Provides consistent handling of auth errors across all API calls\n */\nfunction handleAuthError(error, operation) {\n  console.error(` Error ${operation}:`, error.message);\n  \n  if (error.response) {\n    console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n    \n    if (error.response.data) {\n      console.error('Response data:', JSON.stringify(error.response.data, null, 2));\n    }\n    \n    // Handle specific status codes\n    if (error.response.status === 401) {\n      console.log('\\n Authentication Error:');\n      console.log(' API key authentication failed');\n      console.log('   - Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      console.log('   - Confirm the API key has the required scopes (OAuth2Read OAuth2Write OAuth2ReadPII)');\n      \n      // Try to extract auth error details if available in the response\n      if (error.response.data && error.response.data.message) {\n        console.log(`\\nServer message: ${error.response.data.message}`);\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.log('\\n Authorization Error:');\n      console.log(' Insufficient permissions for this operation');\n      console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n      console.log('   - Required scopes: OAuth2Read OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Write');\n      console.log('   - Edit your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal to add missing scopes');\n    } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n      console.log('\\n Rate Limit Error:');\n      console.log(' Too many requests in a short period');\n      console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      \n      // Extract rate limit details from headers if available\n      const resetTime = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-reset'];\n      const limit = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-limit'];\n      \n      if (resetTime) {\n        const resetDate = new Date(parseInt(resetTime) * 1000);\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit will reset at: ${resetDate.toLocaleString()}`);\n      }\n      \n      if (limit) {\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit: ${limit} requests`);\n      }\n    }\n  } else if (error.request) {\n    console.error(' No response received from server');\n    console.log(' Likely causes:');\n    console.log('   - Network issue or timeout');\n    console.log('   - Incorrect API endpoint');\n    console.log('   - Server unavailable');\n  } else {\n    console.error(' Error setting up the request:', error.message);\n  }\n}\n```\n\nNow I'll update each of the test functions to use this common error handler:\n\n```javascript\n",

Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      console.log('   - Confirm the API key has the required scopes (OAuth2Read OAuth2Write OAuth2ReadPII)');\n      \n      // Try to extract auth error details if available in the response\n      if (error.response.data && error.response.data.message) {\n        console.log(`\\nServer message: ${error.response.data.message}`);\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.log('\\n Authorization Error:');\n      console.log(' Insufficient permissions for this operation');\n      console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n      console.log('   - Required scopes: OAuth2Read OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Write');\n      console.log('   - Edit your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal to add missing scopes');\n    } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n      console.log('\\n Rate Limit Error:');\n      console.log(' Too many requests in a short period');\n      console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      \n      // Extract rate limit details from headers if available\n      const resetTime = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-reset'];\n      const limit = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-limit'];\n      \n      if (resetTime) {\n        const resetDate = new Date(parseInt(resetTime) * 1000);\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit will reset at: ${resetDate.toLocaleString()}`);\n      }\n      \n      if (limit) {\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit: ${limit} requests`);\n      }\n    }\n  } else if (error.request) {\n    console.error(' No response received from server');\n    console.log(' Likely causes:');\n    console.log('   - This might involve re-authenticating or checking API key configurations.\r\n\r\nTest Different Endpoints: Continue testing various API endpoints to ensure that authentication and authorization are working as expected across different resources.\r\n\r\nHere's an example of how you might enhance error handling for authentication issues:\r\n\r\njavascript\r\ntry {\r\n  const response = await axios({\r\n    method: method,\r\n    url: fullUrl,\r\n    headers: headers,\r\n    params: queryParams\r\n  });\r\n  \r\n  // Handle successful responses\r\n  printResponseDetails(response);\r\n  \r\n  if (response.status === 200) {\r\n    console.log(' Documents retrieved');\r\n    console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data.items?.length || 0}`);\r\n  } else if (response.status === 204) {\r\n    console.log(' No content returned');\r\n  }\r\n  \r\n} catch (error) {\r\n  if (error.response) {\r\n    if (error.response.status === 401) {\r\n      console.error(' Authentication failed.             {
              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "After reviewing the `direct-api-calls.js` file and your requirements, I'll enhance the authentication error handling across all API calls and add more comprehensive error reporting.\n\nHere's a list of updates to each file with their name and path:\n\n* [`tests/direct-api-calls.js`](tests/direct-api-calls.js):\n  * Add a common authentication error handler function\n  * Update all API test functions to use this handler\n  * Improve error messages and diagnostics\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\direct-api-calls.js\n/**\n * Common authentication error handler\n * Provides consistent handling of auth errors across all API calls\n */\nfunction handleAuthError(error, operation) {\n  console.error(` Error ${operation}:`, error.message);\n  \n  if (error.response) {\n    console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n    \n    if (error.response.data) {\n      console.error('Response data:', JSON.stringify(error.response.data, null, 2));\n    }\n    \n    // Handle specific status codes\n    if (error.response.status === 401) {\n      console.log('\\n Authentication Error:');\n      console.log(' API key authentication failed');\n      console.log('   - Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      console.log('   - Confirm the API key has the required scopes (OAuth2Read OAuth2Write OAuth2ReadPII)');\n      \n      // Try to extract auth error details if available in the response\n      if (error.response.data && error.response.data.message) {\n        console.log(`\\nServer message: ${error.response.data.message}`);\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.log('\\n Authorization Error:');\n      console.log(' Insufficient permissions for this operation');\n      console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n      console.log('   - Required scopes: OAuth2Read OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Write');\n      console.log('   - Edit your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal to add missing scopes');\n    } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n      console.log('\\n Rate Limit Error:');\n      console.log(' Too many requests in a short period');\n      console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      \n      // Extract rate limit details from headers if available\n      const resetTime = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-reset'];\n      const limit = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-limit'];\n      \n      if (resetTime) {\n        const resetDate = new Date(parseInt(resetTime) * 1000);\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit will reset at: ${resetDate.toLocaleString()}`);\n      }\n      \n      if (limit) {\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit: ${limit} requests`);\n      }\n    }\n  } else if (error.request) {\n    console.error(' No response received from server');\n    console.log(' Likely causes:');\n    console.log('   - Network issue or timeout');\n    console.log('   - Incorrect API endpoint');\n    console.log('   - Server unavailable');\n  } else {\n    console.error(' Error setting up the request:', error.message);\n  }\n}\n```\n\nNow I'll update each of the test functions to use this common error handler:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\direct-api-calls.js\n/**\n * Test 0: Explicitly test authentication\n */\nasync function testAuthentication() {\n  // ... existing code ...\n  \n  try {\n    // ... existing code ...\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'during authentication');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 1: Get session info\n */\nasync function getSessionInfo() {\n  // ... existing code ...\n  \n  try {\n    // ... existing code ...\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'retrieving session info');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  // ... existing code ...\n  \n  try {\n    // ... existing code ...\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'retrieving documents');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  // ... existing code ...\n  \n  try {\n    // ... existing code ...\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'creating document');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 4: Delete the created document\n */\nasync function deleteCreatedDocument() {\n  // ... existing code ...\n  \n  try {\n    // ... existing code ...\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'deleting document');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 5: Verify document was deleted\n */\nasync function verifyDocumentDeleted() {\n  // ... existing code ...\n  \n  try {\n    // ... existing code ...\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'verifying document deletion');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n```\n\nThis update:\n\n1. Creates a centralized `handleAuthError` function that provides consistent error handling\n2. Specifically handles 401 (Unauthorized), 403 (Forbidden), and 429 (Rate Limited) errors\n3. Provides helpful diagnostic information and suggested remediation steps\n4. Extracts rate limit information from response headers when available\n5. Maintains the existing code style and function structure\n6. Uses defensive programming by checking for the existence of properties before accessing them\n7. Updates all test functions to use the common error handler\n8. Follows Onshape's documented OAuth scope format (space-separated)\n\nThese changes will help better diagnose authentication issues while maintaining all existing functionality."

        {
          "value": "/**\n * Common authentication error handler\n * Provides consistent handling of auth errors across all API calls\n */\nfunction handleAuthError(error, operation) {\n  console.error(` Error ${operation}:`, error.message);\n  \n  if (error.response) {\n    console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n    \n    if (error.response.data) {\n      console.error('Response data:', JSON.stringify(error.response.data, null, 2));\n    }\n    \n    // Handle specific status codes\n    if (error.response.status === 401) {\n      console.log('\\n Authentication Error:');\n      console.log(' API key authentication failed');\n      console.log('   - Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      console.log('   - Confirm the API key has the required scopes (OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write)');\n      \n      // Try to extract auth error details if available in the response\n      if (error.response.data && error.response.data.message) {\n        console.log(`\\nServer message: ${error.response.data.message}`);\n      }\n      \n      // Add operation-specific guidance\n      switch (operation) {\n        case 'retrieving documents':\n          console.log('\\n For document access:');\n          console.log('   - Ensure your API key has at least OAuth2Read scope');\n          console.log('   - Check if you have access to the requested documents');\n          break;\n        case 'creating document':\n          console.log('\\n For document creation:');\n          console.log('   - Ensure your API key has OAuth2Write scope');\n          break;\n        case 'deleting document':\n          console.log('\\n For document deletion:');\n          console.log('   - Ensure your API key has OAuth2Delete scope');\n          console.log('   - Verify you are the owner of the document or have admin privileges');\n          break;\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.log('\\n Authorization Error:');\n      console.log(' Insufficient permissions for this operation');\n      console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n      console.log('   - Required scopes: OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write');\n      console.log('   - Edit your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal to add missing scopes');\n      \n      // Add operation-specific guidance for 403 errors\n      switch (operation) {\n        case 'retrieving documents':\n          console.log('   - For document access, your key needs OAuth2Read scope');\n          break;\n        case 'creating document':\n          console.log('   - For document creation, your key needs OAuth2Write scope');\n          break;\n        case 'deleting document':\n          console.log('   - For document deletion, your key needs OAuth2Delete scope');\n          break;\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n      console.log('\\n Rate Limit Error:');\n      console.log(' Too many requests in a short period');\n      console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      \n      // Extract rate limit details from headers if available\n      const resetTime = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-reset'];\n      const limit = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-limit'];\n      \n      if (resetTime) {\n        const resetDate = new Date(parseInt(resetTime) * 1000);\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit will reset at: ${resetDate.toLocaleString()}`);\n      }\n      \n      if (limit) {\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit: ${limit} requests`);\n      }\n    }\n  } else if (error.request) {\n    console.error(' No response received from server');\n    console.log(' Likely causes:');\n    console.log('   - Network issue or timeout');\n    console.log('   - Incorrect API endpoint');\n    console.log('   - Server unavailable');\n  } else {\n    console.error(' Error setting up the request:', error.message);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes and add permission diagnostics\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved (no content)');\n      globals.existingDocumentCount = 0;\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n      console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data?.items?.length || 0}`);\n      \n      if (response.data?.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n        console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n        console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n        console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n      } else if (response.data?.items && response.data.items.length === 0) {\n        console.log('\\n No documents found. This could indicate:');\n        console.log('   - Your account has no documents');\n        console.log('   - Your API key doesn\\'t have sufficient permissions');\n        console.log('   - The filter parameters excluded all documents');\n      }\n      \n      // Store document count for later tests\n      globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data?.items?.length || 0;\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n      assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined for 200 status');\n    }\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'retrieving documents');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, null, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Document created (no content returned)');\n      console.log(' Unable to retrieve document ID from response. Document deletion may fail.');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data?.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data?.id || 'ID not available'}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data?.href || 'URL not available'}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      globals.testDocumentId = response.data?.id;\n      \n      // Log permission details\n      if (response.headers['location']) {\n        console.log(`Document location: ${response.headers['location']}`);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n      assert(response.data?.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined for 200 status');\n    }\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    // Special handling for document creation errors\n    if (error.response && error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.error(' Error creating document: Insufficient permissions');\n      console.log('\\n Document Creation Requires:');\n      console.log('   - OAuth2Write scope in your API key permissions');\n      console.log('   - An active Onshape subscription or plan that allows document creation');\n      console.log('   - You may have reached your plan\\'s document limit');\n    } else {\n      handleAuthError(error, 'creating document');\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await testAuthentication();  // Run authentication test first\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  testAuthentication,\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n```\n\nThis update:\n\n1. Enhances ",

            {
              "code": "/**\n * Common authentication error handler\n * Provides consistent handling of auth errors across all API calls\n */\nfunction handleAuthError(error, operation) {\n  console.error(` Error ${operation}:`, error.message);\n  \n  if (error.response) {\n    console.error(`Status: ${error.response.status}`);\n    \n    if (error.response.data) {\n      console.error('Response data:', JSON.stringify(error.response.data, null, 2));\n    }\n    \n    // Handle specific status codes\n    if (error.response.status === 401) {\n      console.log('\\n Authentication Error:');\n      console.log(' API key authentication failed');\n      console.log('   - Check your ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY values');\n      console.log('   - Verify the API key is still active in Onshape');\n      console.log('   - Confirm the API key has the required scopes (OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write)');\n      \n      // Try to extract auth error details if available in the response\n      if (error.response.data && error.response.data.message) {\n        console.log(`\\nServer message: ${error.response.data.message}`);\n      }\n      \n      // Add operation-specific guidance\n      switch (operation) {\n        case 'retrieving documents':\n          console.log('\\n For document access:');\n          console.log('   - Ensure your API key has at least OAuth2Read scope');\n          console.log('   - Check if you have access to the requested documents');\n          break;\n        case 'creating document':\n          console.log('\\n For document creation:');\n          console.log('   - Ensure your API key has OAuth2Write scope');\n          break;\n        case 'deleting document':\n          console.log('\\n For document deletion:');\n          console.log('   - Ensure your API key has OAuth2Delete scope');\n          console.log('   - Verify you are the owner of the document or have admin privileges');\n          break;\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.log('\\n Authorization Error:');\n      console.log(' Insufficient permissions for this operation');\n      console.log('   - Your API key lacks the required OAuth scopes');\n      console.log('   - Required scopes: OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write');\n      console.log('   - Edit your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal to add missing scopes');\n      \n      // Add operation-specific guidance for 403 errors\n      switch (operation) {\n        case 'retrieving documents':\n          console.log('   - For document access, your key needs OAuth2Read scope');\n          break;\n        case 'creating document':\n          console.log('   - For document creation, your key needs OAuth2Write scope');\n          break;\n        case 'deleting document':\n          console.log('   - For document deletion, your key needs OAuth2Delete scope');\n          break;\n      }\n    } else if (error.response.status === 429) {\n      console.log('\\n Rate Limit Error:');\n      console.log(' Too many requests in a short period');\n      console.log('   - Implement request throttling');\n      \n      // Extract rate limit details from headers if available\n      const resetTime = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-reset'];\n      const limit = error.response.headers['x-ratelimit-limit'];\n      \n      if (resetTime) {\n        const resetDate = new Date(parseInt(resetTime) * 1000);\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit will reset at: ${resetDate.toLocaleString()}`);\n      }\n      \n      if (limit) {\n        console.log(`   - Rate limit: ${limit} requests`);\n      }\n    }\n  } else if (error.request) {\n    console.error(' No response received from server');\n    console.log(' Likely causes:');\n    console.log('   - Network issue or timeout');\n    console.log('   - Incorrect API endpoint');\n    console.log('   - Server unavailable');\n  } else {\n    console.error(' Error setting up the request:', error.message);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 2: Get my documents\n */\nasync function getMyDocuments() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 2: Get my documents with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'GET';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Query parameters:', JSON.stringify(queryParams, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, queryParams);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, queryParams);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      params: queryParams\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes and add permission diagnostics\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved (no content)');\n      globals.existingDocumentCount = 0;\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Documents retrieved');\n      console.log(`Total documents: ${response.data?.items?.length || 0}`);\n      \n      if (response.data?.items && response.data.items.length > 0) {\n        console.log('\\nFirst document:');\n        console.log(`Name: ${response.data.items[0].name}`);\n        console.log(`ID: ${response.data.items[0].id}`);\n      } else if (response.data?.items && response.data.items.length === 0) {\n        console.log('\\n No documents found. This could indicate:');\n        console.log('   - Your account has no documents');\n        console.log('   - Your API key doesn\\'t have sufficient permissions');\n        console.log('   - The filter parameters excluded all documents');\n      }\n      \n      // Store document count for later tests\n      globals.existingDocumentCount = response.data?.items?.length || 0;\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n      assert(response.data !== undefined, 'Response data should be defined for 200 status');\n    }\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    handleAuthError(error, 'retrieving documents');\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Test 3: Create a public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, 2));\n  \n  try {\n    // Generate authentication headers\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders(method, urlPath, {}, documentData);\n    \n    // Print request details\n    printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, null, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Document created (no content returned)');\n      console.log(' Unable to retrieve document ID from response. Document deletion may fail.');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data?.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data?.id || 'ID not available'}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data?.href || 'URL not available'}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      globals.testDocumentId = response.data?.id;\n      \n      // Log permission details\n      if (response.headers['location']) {\n        console.log(`Document location: ${response.headers['location']}`);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n      assert(response.data?.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined for 200 status');\n    }\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    // Special handling for document creation errors\n    if (error.response && error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.error(' Error creating document: Insufficient permissions');\n      console.log('\\n Document Creation Requires:');\n      console.log('   - OAuth2Write scope in your API key permissions');\n      console.log('   - An active Onshape subscription or plan that allows document creation');\n      console.log('   - You may have reached your plan\\'s document limit');\n    } else {\n      handleAuthError(error, 'creating document');\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials. Tests will be skipped.');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  try {\n    await testAuthentication();  // Run authentication test first\n    await getSessionInfo();\n    await getMyDocuments();\n    await createPublicDocument();\n    await deleteCreatedDocument();\n    await verifyDocumentDeleted();\n    \n    console.log('\\n All tests completed successfully!');\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('\\n Test failed:', error.message);\n    process.exit(1);\n  }\n}\n\n// Export functions for use in other scripts\nmodule.exports = {\n  testAuthentication,\n  getSessionInfo,\n  getMyDocuments,\n  createPublicDocument,\n  deleteCreatedDocument,\n  verifyDocumentDeleted,\n  runAllTests\n};\n",

'/api/v10/documents';\n  const queryParams = {\n    filter: 0,\n    ownerType: 1,\n    sortColumn: 'createdAt',\n    sortOrder: 'desc', \n    offset: 0,\n    limit: 20\n  };\n  const fullUrl = public document\n */\nasync function createPublicDocument() {\n  console.log('\\n Test 3: Create a public document with hardcoded call');\n  \n  const method = 'POST';\n  const baseUrl = 'https://cad.onshape.com';\n  const urlPath = '/api/v10/documents';\n  const fullUrl = `${baseUrl}${urlPath}`;\n  \n  // Hardcoded document creation payload\n  const documentData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created via direct API test\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1,  // 0=ANONYMOUS, 1=USER, 2=COMPANY, 3=TEAM, 4=APPLICATION\n    betaCapabilityIds: []  // Optional beta capabilities\n  };\n  \n  console.log(` Making direct API call: ${method} ${fullUrl}`);\n  console.log('Document data:', JSON.stringify(documentData, null, printRequestDetails(method, fullUrl, headers, null, documentData);\n    \n    // Make the API call with axios\n    const response = await axios({\n      method: method,\n      url: fullUrl,\n      headers: headers,\n      data: documentData\n    });\n    \n    // Print response details\n    printResponseDetails(response);\n    \n    // Handle different successful status codes\n    if (response.status === 204) {\n      console.log(' Document created (no content returned)');\n      console.log(' Unable to retrieve document ID from response. Document deletion may fail.');\n    } else {\n      console.log(' Document created');\n      console.log(`Name: ${response.data?.name || 'Name not available'}`);\n      console.log(`ID: ${response.data?.id || 'ID not available'}`);\n      console.log(`URL: ${response.data?.href || 'URL not available'}`);\n      \n      // Store document ID for deletion in next test\n      globals.testDocumentId = response.data?.id;\n      \n      // Log permission details\n      if (response.headers['location']) {\n        console.log(`Document location: ${response.headers['location']}`);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    assert(response.status === 200 || response.status === 204, 'Status code should be 200 or 204');\n    if (response.status === 200) {\n      assert(response.data?.id !== undefined, 'Document ID should be defined for 200 status');\n    }\n    \n    return response.data || {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    // Special handling for document creation errors\n    if (error.response && error.response.status === 403) {\n      console.error(' Error creating document: Insufficient permissions');\n      console.log('\\n Document Creation Requires:');\n      console.log('   - OAuth2Write scope in your API key permissions');\n      console.log('   - An active Onshape subscription or plan that allows document creation');\n      console.log('   - You may have reached your plan\\'s document limit');\n    } else {\n      handleAuthError(error, 'creating document');\n    }\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Run all tests in sequence\n */\nasync function runAllTests() {\n  console.log(' Running Direct Onshape API Tests');\n  \n  // Check credentials\n  if (!ACCESS_KEY || !SECRET_KEY) {\n    console.warn(' Missing API credentials.         {
          "value": "/**\n * Get API key authentication headers\n * Following format from official Onshape JavaScript client\n * @param {string} method - HTTP method\n * @param {string} path - API path\n * @param {Object} queryParams - Query parameters\n * @param {string} body - Request body\n * @returns {Object} API key headers\n * @private\n */\n_getApiKeyHeaders(method, path, queryParams = {}, body = '') {\n  // Ensure path starts with /\n  const pathname = path.startsWith('/') ? path : `/${path}`;\n  \n  // Current date in RFC format\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  \n  // Generate nonce\n  const nonce = this._generateNonce();\n  \n  // Content type - always application/json for our API\n  const contentType = 'application/json';\n\n  // Build query string - must be sorted alphabetically\n  const queryString = this._buildQueryString(queryParams);\n\n  // Complete path with query string\n  const fullPath = pathname + (queryString ? `?${queryString}` : '');\n\n  // Calculate MD5 hash for body if present\n  let contentMd5 = '';\n  if (body && body.length > 0) {\n    contentMd5 = crypto.createHash('md5').update(body).digest('base64');\n  }\n\n  // String to sign precisely as specified by Onshape API docs\n  // This is the critical fix: format must be exact\n  const hmacString = [\n    method.toUpperCase(),\n    contentMd5,\n    contentType,\n    date,\n    nonce,\n    fullPath\n  ].join('\\n');\n\n  // Generate HMAC signature\n  const signature = crypto.createHmac('sha256', this.secretKey)\n    .update(hmacString)\n    .digest('base64');\n\n  // Build headers object\n  const headers = {\n    'Content-Type': contentType,\n    'Accept': 'application/json',\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Authorization': `On ${this.accessKey}:${signature}`\n  };\n\n  // Add MD5 hash if body is present\n  if (contentMd5) {\n    headers['Content-MD5'] = contentMd5;\n  }\n\n  return headers;\n}\n```\n\n## Adding API Permission Check Test\n\nCreate a test file that specifically checks API permissions:\n\n```javascript\n",

        {
          "value": "require('dotenv').config();\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\n\ndescribe('Onshape API Permissions Check', () => {\n  const ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\n  const SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n  const BASE_URL = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v6';\n  \n  function generateAuthHeaders(method, path) {\n    const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n    const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n    const contentType = 'application/json';\n\n    // String to sign\n    const stringToSign = [\n      method.toUpperCase(),\n      '',  // empty contentMd5\n      contentType,\n      date,\n      nonce,\n      path\n    ].join('\\n');\n\n    // Generate signature\n    const signature = crypto\n      .createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY)\n      .update(stringToSign)\n      .digest('base64');\n\n    return {\n      'Content-Type': contentType,\n      'Accept': 'application/json',\n      'Date': date,\n      'On-Nonce': nonce,\n      'Authorization': `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:${signature}`\n    };\n  }\n  \n  test('API key should have OAuth2Read permission', async () => {\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders('GET', '/users/sessioninfo');\n    \n    const response = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${BASE_URL}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers\n    });\n    \n    expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    console.log('User info successfully retrieved');\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes in response\n    if (response.data.oauth2Scopes) {\n      const scopes = Array.isArray(response.data.oauth2Scopes) \n        ? response.data.oauth2Scopes.join(' ')\n        : response.data.oauth2Scopes.toString();\n        \n      console.log('API Key Scopes:', scopes);\n      \n      const hasReadScope = scopes.includes('OAuth2Read');\n      const hasWriteScope = scopes.includes('OAuth2Write');\n      \n      console.log('Has OAuth2Read:', hasReadScope);\n      console.log('Has OAuth2Write:', hasWriteScope);\n      \n      if (!hasReadScope || !hasWriteScope) {\n        console.error(' Missing required scopes. Please update your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal');\n      }\n    }\n  });\n});\n```\n\n## Update API Key with Required Scopes\n\n1.               "code": "/**\n * Get API key authentication headers\n * Following format from official Onshape JavaScript client\n * @param {string} method - HTTP method\n * @param {string} path - API path\n * @param {Object} queryParams - Query parameters\n * @param {string} body - Request body\n * @returns {Object} API key headers\n * @private\n */\n_getApiKeyHeaders(method, path, queryParams = {}, body = '') {\n  // Ensure path starts with /\n  const pathname = path.startsWith('/') ? path : `/${path}`;\n  \n  // Current date in RFC format\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  \n  // Generate nonce\n  const nonce = this._generateNonce();\n  \n  // Content type - always application/json for our API\n  const contentType = 'application/json';\n\n  // Build query string - must be sorted alphabetically\n  const queryString = this._buildQueryString(queryParams);\n\n  // Complete path with query string\n  const fullPath = pathname + (queryString ? `?${queryString}` : '');\n\n  // Calculate MD5 hash for body if present\n  let contentMd5 = '';\n  if (body && body.length > 0) {\n    contentMd5 = crypto.createHash('md5').update(body).digest('base64');\n  }\n\n  // String to sign precisely as specified by Onshape API docs\n  // This is the critical fix: format must be exact\n  const hmacString = [\n    method.toUpperCase(),\n    contentMd5,\n    contentType,\n    date,\n    nonce,\n    fullPath\n  ].join('\\n');\n\n  // Generate HMAC signature\n  const signature = crypto.createHmac('sha256', this.secretKey)\n    .update(hmacString)\n    .digest('base64');\n\n  // Build headers object\n  const headers = {\n    'Content-Type': contentType,\n    'Accept': 'application/json',\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Authorization': `On ${this.accessKey}:${signature}`\n  };\n\n  // Add MD5 hash if body is present\n  if (contentMd5) {\n    headers['Content-MD5'] = contentMd5;\n  }\n\n  return headers;\n}\n",

              "code": "require('dotenv').config();\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\n\ndescribe('Onshape API Permissions Check', () => {\n  const ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\n  const SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n  const BASE_URL = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v6';\n  \n  function generateAuthHeaders(method, path) {\n    const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n    const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n    const contentType = 'application/json';\n\n    // String to sign\n    const stringToSign = [\n      method.toUpperCase(),\n      '',  // empty contentMd5\n      contentType,\n      date,\n      nonce,\n      path\n    ].join('\\n');\n\n    // Generate signature\n    const signature = crypto\n      .createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY)\n      .update(stringToSign)\n      .digest('base64');\n\n    return {\n      'Content-Type': contentType,\n      'Accept': 'application/json',\n      'Date': date,\n      'On-Nonce': nonce,\n      'Authorization': `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:${signature}`\n    };\n  }\n  \n  test('API key should have OAuth2Read permission', async () => {\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders('GET', '/users/sessioninfo');\n    \n    const response = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${BASE_URL}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers\n    });\n    \n    expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    console.log('User info successfully retrieved');\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes in response\n    if (response.data.oauth2Scopes) {\n      const scopes = Array.isArray(response.data.oauth2Scopes) \n        ? Please update your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal');\n      }\n    }\n  });\n});\n",

Onshape supports multiple authentication mechanisms, but you're mixing them up:\r\n\r\nBasic Auth: Works for the session info endpoint (Base64 encoded access_key:secret_key)\r\nBearer Token Auth: Not working in your case (with raw access_key:secret_key)\r\nCustom On Authentication: Partially working with your Python implementation\r\n\r\nHow to Fix It\r\nThe solution is to stick with one consistent authentication method. Based on your results, let's modify your Python class to use Basic Authentication instead of the custom On authentication mechanism: "

            {
              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "# Authentication Analysis and Solution for Integration Tests\n\nBased on the failing integration tests and the error messages, I've identified that your application is experiencing authentication issues with the Onshape API. Here's a comprehensive analysis and solution to fix the authentication problems in your tests.\n\n## Root Cause Analysis\n\nThe key issues I've identified are:\n\n1. **API Scope Mismatch**: Your API key doesn't have the necessary permissions (OAuth scopes)\n2. **Authentication Format Inconsistency**: The application may be using different authentication formats in different requests\n3. **API Version Mismatch**: Authentication parameters might need to be adjusted for the specific API version\n\n## Solution: Update Authentication Headers Format\n\nI recommend updating the `src/auth/auth-manager.js` file to ensure consistent authentication based on Onshape's requirements:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\src\\auth\\auth-manager.js\n\n/**\n * Get API key authentication headers\n * Following format from official Onshape JavaScript client\n * @param {string} method - HTTP method\n * @param {string} path - API path\n * @param {Object} queryParams - Query parameters\n * @param {string} body - Request body\n * @returns {Object} API key headers\n * @private\n */\n_getApiKeyHeaders(method, path, queryParams = {}, body = '') {\n  // Ensure path starts with /\n  const pathname = path.startsWith('/') ? path : `/${path}`;\n  \n  // Current date in RFC format\n  const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n  \n  // Generate nonce\n  const nonce = this._generateNonce();\n  \n  // Content type - always application/json for our API\n  const contentType = 'application/json';\n\n  // Build query string - must be sorted alphabetically\n  const queryString = this._buildQueryString(queryParams);\n\n  // Complete path with query string\n  const fullPath = pathname + (queryString ? `?${queryString}` : '');\n\n  // Calculate MD5 hash for body if present\n  let contentMd5 = '';\n  if (body && body.length > 0) {\n    contentMd5 = crypto.createHash('md5').update(body).digest('base64');\n  }\n\n  // String to sign precisely as specified by Onshape API docs\n  // This is the critical fix: format must be exact\n  const hmacString = [\n    method.toUpperCase(),\n    contentMd5,\n    contentType,\n    date,\n    nonce,\n    fullPath\n  ].join('\\n');\n\n  // Generate HMAC signature\n  const signature = crypto.createHmac('sha256', this.secretKey)\n    .update(hmacString)\n    .digest('base64');\n\n  // Build headers object\n  const headers = {\n    'Content-Type': contentType,\n    'Accept': 'application/json',\n    'Date': date,\n    'On-Nonce': nonce,\n    'Authorization': `On ${this.accessKey}:${signature}`\n  };\n\n  // Add MD5 hash if body is present\n  if (contentMd5) {\n    headers['Content-MD5'] = contentMd5;\n  }\n\n  return headers;\n}\n```\n\n## Adding API Permission Check Test\n\nCreate a test file that specifically checks API permissions:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\api-permissions-check.integration.test.js\n\nrequire('dotenv').config();\nconst axios = require('axios');\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\n\ndescribe('Onshape API Permissions Check', () => {\n  const ACCESS_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY;\n  const SECRET_KEY = process.env.ONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY;\n  const BASE_URL = process.env.ONSHAPE_API_URL || 'https://cad.onshape.com/api/v6';\n  \n  function generateAuthHeaders(method, path) {\n    const date = new Date().toUTCString();\n    const nonce = crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('base64');\n    const contentType = 'application/json';\n\n    // String to sign\n    const stringToSign = [\n      method.toUpperCase(),\n      '',  // empty contentMd5\n      contentType,\n      date,\n      nonce,\n      path\n    ].join('\\n');\n\n    // Generate signature\n    const signature = crypto\n      .createHmac('sha256', SECRET_KEY)\n      .update(stringToSign)\n      .digest('base64');\n\n    return {\n      'Content-Type': contentType,\n      'Accept': 'application/json',\n      'Date': date,\n      'On-Nonce': nonce,\n      'Authorization': `On ${ACCESS_KEY}:${signature}`\n    };\n  }\n  \n  test('API key should have OAuth2Read permission', async () => {\n    const headers = generateAuthHeaders('GET', '/users/sessioninfo');\n    \n    const response = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${BASE_URL}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers\n    });\n    \n    expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    console.log('User info successfully retrieved');\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes in response\n    if (response.data.oauth2Scopes) {\n      const scopes = Array.isArray(response.data.oauth2Scopes) \n        ? response.data.oauth2Scopes.join(' ')\n        : response.data.oauth2Scopes.toString();\n        \n      console.log('API Key Scopes:', scopes);\n      \n      const hasReadScope = scopes.includes('OAuth2Read');\n      const hasWriteScope = scopes.includes('OAuth2Write');\n      \n      console.log('Has OAuth2Read:', hasReadScope);\n      console.log('Has OAuth2Write:', hasWriteScope);\n      \n      if (!hasReadScope || !hasWriteScope) {\n        console.error(' Missing required scopes. Please update your API key in the Onshape Developer Portal');\n      }\n    }\n  });\n});\n```\n\n## Update API Key with Required Scopes\n\n1. Go to the [Onshape Developer Portal](https://dev-portal.onshape.com/keys)\n2. Generate a new API key with these scopes: `OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write`\n3. Update your `.env` file with the new keys:\n\n```\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\.env\nONSHAPE_ACCESS_KEY=your_new_access_key\nONSHAPE_SECRET_KEY=your_new_secret_key\n```\n\n## Optional: Conditional Tests for Free Accounts\n\nUpdate `tests/sketch.integration.test.js` to conditionally skip tests when permissions are insufficient:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\sketch.integration.test.js\n\nbeforeAll(async () => {\n  try {\n    // First check permissions\n    const userInfo = await auth.get('/users/sessioninfo');\n    \n    // Analyze OAuth scopes\n    let hasWriteAccess = false;\n    if (typeof userInfo.oauth2Scopes === 'number') {\n      const scopeValue = userInfo.oauth2Scopes;\n      // Check if OAuth2Write bit is set\n      hasWriteAccess = (scopeValue & 2) === 2; // 2 is the bit value for OAuth2Write\n    } else if (Array.isArray(userInfo.oauth2Scopes)) {\n      hasWriteAccess = userInfo.oauth2Scopes.some(scope => \n        scope.includes('OAuth2Write') || scope.includes('write'));\n    }\n    \n    if (!hasWriteAccess) {\n      console.warn(' API key lacks OAuth2Write permission. Tests will be skipped.');\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    console.log('Setting up integration test with direct API access');\n    \n    // Continue with test setup...\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"API Setup Failed:\", error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n});\n```\n\n## Troubleshooting Guide\n\nIf you continue to experience issues after implementing these changes:\n\n1. **Check API Version**: Ensure your code matches the API version in your `.env` file\n2. **Verify Authentication Formats**: \n   - The format must be `On {ACCESS_KEY}:{SIGNATURE}` for API keys\n   - For OAuth, use `Bearer {TOKEN}`\n3. **Double-Check Scopes**: Run the permissions test to verify your key has the required scopes\n4. **Examine Request Format**: Use tools like Postman or the `tests/onshape-api-debug.js` script to examine request details\n\nBy implementing these changes, your integration tests should successfully authenticate with the Onshape API and perform the necessary operations."

          "value": "/**\n * Generate authentication headers\n * Using Basic Auth which has proven more reliable for API access\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, path, queryParams = {}) {\n  // Create base64 encoded credentials for Basic Auth\n  const credentials = Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Return headers with Basic authentication\n  return {\n    'Authorization': `Basic ${credentials}`,\n    'Content-Type': 'application/json',\n    'Accept': 'application/json'\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Parse and analyze OAuth scopes from API response\n */\nfunction analyzeOAuthScopes(scopeData) {\n  if (!scopeData) return { scopes: [], has: {} };\n  \n  let scopes = [];\n  \n  // Handle different scope formats\n  if (typeof scopeData === 'number') {\n    // Bitwise representation\n    const scopeMap = {\n      1: 'OAuth2Read',\n      2: 'OAuth2Write',\n      4: 'OAuth2Delete',\n      8: 'OAuth2ReadPII'\n    };\n    \n    Object.entries(scopeMap).forEach(([bit, scope]) => {\n      if ((scopeData & parseInt(bit)) !== 0) {\n        scopes.push(scope);\n      }\n    });\n  } else if (typeof scopeData === 'string') {\n    // Space-separated string\n    scopes = scopeData.split(' ').filter(s => s);\n  } else if (Array.isArray(scopeData)) {\n    // Array of scope strings\n    scopes = scopeData;\n  }\n  \n  // Check for specific permissions\n  const hasRead = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Read') && !s.includes('OAuth2ReadPII'));\n  const hasWrite = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Write'));\n  const hasDelete = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Delete'));\n  const hasReadPII = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2ReadPII'));\n  \n  return {\n    scopes,\n    formatted: scopes.join(' '),\n    has: {\n      read: hasRead,\n      write: hasWrite,\n      delete: hasDelete,\n      readPII: hasReadPII\n    }\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Test different API endpoints to check permissions\n */\nasync function checkPermissions() {\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log('ONSHAPE API PERMISSIONS TEST');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log(`Using API key: ${accessKey.substring(0, 4)}...`);\n  console.log(`Using authentication method: Basic Auth`);\n\n  // Test A: Check auth methods to find which one works best\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST A: AUTH METHOD CHECK ----------');\n  \n  // Test with Basic Auth\n  console.log('Testing Basic Auth...');\n  const basicAuthHeaders = {\n    'Authorization': `Basic ${Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64')}`,\n    'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n  };\n  \n  try {\n    const basicAuthResponse = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${baseUrl}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers: basicAuthHeaders,\n      validateStatus: function (status) {\n        return status >= 200 && status < 300;\n      }\n    });\n    console.log(` Basic Auth Success! Status: ${basicAuthResponse.status}`);\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes\n    const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(basicAuthResponse.data.oauth2Scopes);\n    console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted || 'None found');\n    console.log('Has Read Permission:', scopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Write Permission:', scopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Delete Permission:', scopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has ReadPII Permission:', scopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    \n    // Store scope info for summary\n    globalScopeInfo = scopeInfo;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(` Basic Auth Failed! Status: ${error.response?.status || 'Unknown'}`);\n    console.error('Error message:', error.response?.data?.message || error.message);\n  }\n\n  // Test 1: Get user info (Read access)\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST 1: READ USER INFO ----------');\n  const userInfo = await makeRequest('GET', '/users/sessioninfo');\n  let userInfoAccess = false;\n  if (userInfo) {\n    console.log('User info retrieved successfully');\n    console.log('Name:', userInfo.name);\n    console.log('Email:', userInfo.email);\n    console.log('Plan:', userInfo.plan);\n    \n    // Parse and display OAuth scopes\n    if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes !== undefined) {\n      const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n      console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted);\n    }\n    \n    userInfoAccess = true;\n  }\n\n  // Rest of your existing tests...\n  \n  // Summary section update\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('PERMISSIONS SUMMARY');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  \n  if (globalScopeInfo && globalScopeInfo.scopes.length > 0) {\n    console.log('API Key OAuth Scopes:', globalScopeInfo.formatted);\n    console.log(`Read permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Write permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Delete permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`ReadPII permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log('---------------------------------------------');\n  }\n  \n  console.log(`Test document access: ${testDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`User info access: ${userInfoAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`List documents: ${listDocumentsAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`Create documents: ${createDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  \n  // Provide guidance based on the results\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('RECOMMENDATIONS');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  if (!userInfoAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key may be invalid or expired. Create a new API key.');\n  } else if (!listDocumentsAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Read scope. Add this scope in the Developer Portal.');\n  } else if (!createDocumentAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Write scope. Add this scope in the Developer Portal.');\n  } else {\n    console.log(' Your API key has all the required permissions!');\n    console.log('Required scopes format: OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write');\n  }\n}\n\n// Add this variable at the top of the file with other globals\nlet globalScopeInfo = null;\n```\n\n## Key Improvements:\n\n1. **Switched to Basic Authentication** - More reliable method based on your observations\n2. **Added OAuth Scope Analysis** - Helps diagnose permission issues with your API key\n3. **Added Authentication Method Testing** - Explicitly tests if Basic Auth works\n4. **Enhanced Summary Section** - Shows detailed scope information and specific recommendations\n\n## Explanation:\n\nThis update ensures consistent authentication across all endpoints by using Basic Authentication, which you found working successfully for the session info endpoint. */\nfunction analyzeOAuthScopes(scopeData) {\n  if (!scopeData) return { scopes: [], has: {} };\n  \n  let scopes = [];\n  \n  // Handle different scope formats\n  if (typeof scopeData === 'number') Object.entries(scopeMap).forEach(([bit, scope]) => {\n      if ((scopeData & parseInt(bit)) !== 0) {\n        scopes.push(scope);\n      }\n    });\n  } else if (typeof scopeData === 'string') {\n    // Space-separated string\n    scopes = scopeData.split(' ').filter(s => s);\n  } else if (Array.isArray(scopeData)) {\n    // Array of scope strings\n    scopes = scopeData;\n  }\n  \n  // Check for specific permissions\n  const hasRead = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Read') && !s.includes('OAuth2ReadPII'));\n  const hasWrite = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Write'));\n  const hasDelete = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Delete'));\n  const hasReadPII = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2ReadPII'));\n  \n  return {\n    scopes,\n    formatted: scopes.join(' '),\n    has: {\n      read: hasRead,\n      write: hasWrite,\n      delete: hasDelete,\n      readPII: hasReadPII\n    }\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Test different API endpoints to check permissions\n */\nasync function checkPermissions() {\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log('ONSHAPE API PERMISSIONS TEST');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n console.log('\\n---------- TEST A: AUTH METHOD CHECK ----------');\n  \n  // Test with Basic Auth\n  console.log('Testing Basic Auth...');\n  const basicAuthHeaders = {\n    'Authorization': `Basic ${Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64')}`,\n    'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n  };\n  \n  try {\n    const basicAuthResponse = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${baseUrl}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers: basicAuthHeaders,\n      validateStatus: function (status) {\n        return status >= 200 && status < 300;\n      }\n    });\n    console.log(` Basic Auth Success! Status: ${basicAuthResponse.status}`);\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes\n    const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(basicAuthResponse.data.oauth2Scopes);\n    console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted || 'None found');\n    console.log('Has Read Permission:', scopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Write Permission:', scopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Delete Permission:', scopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has ReadPII Permission:', scopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    \n    // Store scope info for summary\n    globalScopeInfo = scopeInfo;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(` Basic Auth Failed! Status: ${error.response?.status || 'Unknown'}`);\n    console.error('Error message:', error.response?.data?.message || error.message);\n  }\n\n  // Test 1: Get user info (Read access)\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST 1: READ USER INFO ----------');\n  const userInfo = await makeRequest('GET', '/users/sessioninfo');\n  let userInfoAccess = false;\n  if (userInfo) {\n    console.log('User info retrieved successfully');\n    console.log('Name:', userInfo.name);\n    console.log('Email:', userInfo.email);\n    console.log('Plan:', userInfo.plan);\n    \n    // Parse and display OAuth scopes\n    if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes !== undefined) {\n      const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n      console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted);\n    }\n    \n    userInfoAccess = true;\n  }\n\n  // Rest of your existing tests...\n  \n  // Summary section update\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('PERMISSIONS SUMMARY');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  \n  if (globalScopeInfo && globalScopeInfo.scopes.length > 0) {\n    console.log('API Key OAuth Scopes:', globalScopeInfo.formatted);\n    console.log(`Read permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Write permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Delete permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`ReadPII permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log('---------------------------------------------');\n  }\n  \n  console.log(`Test document access: ${testDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`Create documents: ${createDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  \n  // Provide guidance based on the results\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('RECOMMENDATIONS');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  if (!userInfoAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key may be invalid or expired. Create a new API key.');\n  } else if (!listDocumentsAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Read scope. Add this scope in the Developer Portal.');\n  } else if (!createDocumentAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Write scope.               "role": "assistant",
              "content": "# Authentication Issues Analysis and Solution\n\nLooking at the permissions test file and the authentication inconsistencies you're experiencing, I'll update the authentication method to use consistent Basic Authentication across all endpoints.\n\n## List of updates to each file:\n\n* [`tests/permissions-test.js`](tests/permissions-test.js):\n  * Update `generateAuthHeaders` function to use Basic Authentication\n  * Add OAuth scope analysis to identify permission issues\n  * Add test for checking authentication method success\n  * Update summary section to include scope information\n\n## Code changes:\n\n```javascript\n// filepath: c:\\Dev\\GitHub-Projects\\onjs\\tests\\permissions-test.js\n/**\n * Generate authentication headers\n * Using Basic Auth which has proven more reliable for API access\n */\nfunction generateAuthHeaders(method, path, queryParams = {}) {\n  // Create base64 encoded credentials for Basic Auth\n  const credentials = Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64');\n  \n  // Return headers with Basic authentication\n  return {\n    'Authorization': `Basic ${credentials}`,\n    'Content-Type': 'application/json',\n    'Accept': 'application/json'\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Parse and analyze OAuth scopes from API response\n */\nfunction analyzeOAuthScopes(scopeData) {\n  if (!scopeData) return { scopes: [], has: {} };\n  \n  let scopes = [];\n  \n  // Handle different scope formats\n  if (typeof scopeData === 'number') {\n    // Bitwise representation\n    const scopeMap = {\n      1: 'OAuth2Read',\n      2: 'OAuth2Write',\n      4: 'OAuth2Delete',\n      8: 'OAuth2ReadPII'\n    };\n    \n    Object.entries(scopeMap).forEach(([bit, scope]) => {\n      if ((scopeData & parseInt(bit)) !== 0) {\n        scopes.push(scope);\n      }\n    });\n  } else if (typeof scopeData === 'string') {\n    // Space-separated string\n    scopes = scopeData.split(' ').filter(s => s);\n  } else if (Array.isArray(scopeData)) {\n    // Array of scope strings\n    scopes = scopeData;\n  }\n  \n  // Check for specific permissions\n  const hasRead = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Read') && !s.includes('OAuth2ReadPII'));\n  const hasWrite = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Write'));\n  const hasDelete = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2Delete'));\n  const hasReadPII = scopes.some(s => s.includes('OAuth2ReadPII'));\n  \n  return {\n    scopes,\n    formatted: scopes.join(' '),\n    has: {\n      read: hasRead,\n      write: hasWrite,\n      delete: hasDelete,\n      readPII: hasReadPII\n    }\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Test different API endpoints to check permissions\n */\nasync function checkPermissions() {\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log('ONSHAPE API PERMISSIONS TEST');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log(`Using API AUTH METHOD CHECK ----------');\n  \n  // Test with Basic Auth\n  console.log('Testing Basic Auth...');\n  const basicAuthHeaders = {\n    'Authorization': `Basic ${Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64')}`,\n    'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n  };\n  \n  try {\n    const basicAuthResponse = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${baseUrl}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers: basicAuthHeaders,\n      validateStatus: function (status) {\n        return status >= 200 && status < 300;\n      }\n    });\n    console.log(` Basic Auth Success! Status: ${basicAuthResponse.status}`);\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes\n    const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(basicAuthResponse.data.oauth2Scopes);\n    console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted || 'None found');\n    console.log('Has Read Permission:', scopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Write Permission:', scopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Delete Permission:', scopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has ReadPII Permission:', scopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Write permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Delete permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`ReadPII permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log('---------------------------------------------');\n  }\n  \n  console.log(`Test document access: ${testDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`Create documents: ${createDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  \n  // Provide guidance based on the results\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('RECOMMENDATIONS');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  if (!userInfoAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key may be invalid or expired. Validates your credentials\n2. Returns information about your API key in the response, including what OAuth scopes/permissions it has\n3.               "markdownBeforeBlock": "I see the source of confusion. Let me clarify what's happening in this file:\n\n# OAuth Scope Analysis with Basic Auth in \n\nThe file is using Basic Auth for authentication, but is analyzing the OAuth scopes that the Onshape API returns in its response. This is an important distinction to understand:\n\n1. **Authentication Method**: Basic Auth (sending Base64-encoded API credentials)\n2. **Permission Analysis**: OAuth scopes (returned by Onshape in the response)\n\n## How it works:\n\nWhen you authenticate with Basic Auth using your API key and secret, the Onshape API:\n1. Validates your credentials\n2. Returns information about your API key in the response, including what OAuth scopes/permissions it has\n3.           "messages": [
            {
              "role": "user",
              "content": "If this file is using Basic Auth how is OAUTH scope analysis being done?"
            },
            {
              "role": "assistant",
              "content": "I see the source of confusion. Let me clarify what's happening in this file:\n\n# OAuth Scope Analysis with Basic Auth in permissions-test.js\n\nThe file is using Basic Auth for authentication, but is analyzing the OAuth scopes that the Onshape API returns in its response. This is an important distinction to understand:\n\n1. **Authentication Method**: Basic Auth (sending Base64-encoded API credentials)\n2. **Permission Analysis**: OAuth scopes (returned by Onshape in the response)\n\n## How it works:\n\nWhen you authenticate with Basic Auth using your API key and secret, the Onshape API:\n1. Validates your credentials\n2. Returns information about your API key in the response, including what OAuth scopes/permissions it has\n3. The code then analyzes these scopes to determine what operations you're allowed to perform\n\n## Key parts of the code that show this:\n\n```javascript\n// Authentication using Basic Auth\nconst basicAuthHeaders = {\n  'Authorization': `Basic ${Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64')}`,\n  'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n};\n\n// Making the API call with Basic Auth\nconst basicAuthResponse = await axios({\n  method: 'GET',\n  url: `${baseUrl}/users/sessioninfo`,\n  headers: basicAuthHeaders,\n  validateStatus: function (status) {\n    return status >= 200 && status < 300;\n  }\n});\n\n// Analyzing the OAuth scopes FROM THE RESPONSE\nconst scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(basicAuthResponse.data.oauth2Scopes);\n```\n\nThis approach is actually quite clever - it lets you use Basic Auth for authentication (which is simpler) while still being able to determine what permissions your API key has. The OAuth scopes aren't being used for authentication here; they're being extracted from the response to understand and display your permission levels.\n\nThe `analyzeOAuthScopes()` function simply interprets these scope values, regardless of which authentication method was used to obtain them."
            }

          "value": "/**\n * Test different API endpoints to check permissions\n */\nasync function checkPermissions() {\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log('ONSHAPE API PERMISSIONS TEST');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  console.log(`Using API key: ${accessKey.substring(0, 4)}...`);\n  console.log(`Using authentication method: Basic Auth`);\n\n  // Initialize summary variables\n  let globalScopeInfo = null;\n  let testDocumentAccess = false;\n  let userInfoAccess = false;\n  let listDocumentsAccess = false;\n  let createDocumentAccess = false;\n  let deleteAccess = false;\n\n  // Test A: Check auth methods to find which one works best\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST A: AUTH METHOD CHECK ----------');\n  \n  // Test with Basic Auth\n  console.log('Testing Basic Auth...');\n  const basicAuthHeaders = {\n    'Authorization': `Basic ${Buffer.from(`${accessKey}:${secretKey}`).toString('base64')}`,\n    'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n  };\n  \n  try {\n    const basicAuthResponse = await axios({\n      method: 'GET',\n      url: `${baseUrl}/users/sessioninfo`,\n      headers: basicAuthHeaders,\n      validateStatus: function (status) {\n        return status >= 200 && status < 300;\n      }\n    });\n    console.log(` Basic Auth Success! Status: ${basicAuthResponse.status}`);\n    \n    // Check for OAuth scopes\n    const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(basicAuthResponse.data.oauth2Scopes);\n    console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted || 'None found');\n    console.log('Has Read Permission:', scopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Write Permission:', scopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has Delete Permission:', scopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    console.log('Has ReadPII Permission:', scopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No');\n    \n    // Store scope info for summary\n    globalScopeInfo = scopeInfo;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(` Basic Auth Failed! Status: ${error.response?.status || 'Unknown'}`);\n    console.error('Error message:', error.response?.data?.message || error.message);\n  }\n\n  // Test 1: Get user info (Read access)\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST 1: READ USER INFO ----------');\n  const userInfo = await makeRequest('GET', '/users/sessioninfo');\n  \n  if (userInfo) {\n    console.log('User info retrieved successfully');\n    console.log('Name:', userInfo.name);\n    console.log('Email:', userInfo.email);\n    console.log('Plan:', userInfo.plan);\n    \n    // Parse and display OAuth scopes\n    if (userInfo.oauth2Scopes !== undefined) {\n      const scopeInfo = analyzeOAuthScopes(userInfo.oauth2Scopes);\n      console.log('OAuth Scopes:', scopeInfo.formatted);\n    }\n    \n    userInfoAccess = true;\n  }\n\n  // Test 2: List documents (Read access)\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST 2: LIST DOCUMENTS ----------');\n  const documents = await makeRequest('GET', '/documents', null, {\n    limit: 5\n  });\n  \n  if (documents && documents.items) {\n    console.log(`Successfully retrieved ${documents.items.length} documents`);\n    if (documents.items.length > 0) {\n      console.log('First document:', documents.items[0].name);\n    }\n    listDocumentsAccess = true;\n  }\n\n  // Test 3: Create a document (Write access)\n  console.log('\\n---------- TEST 3: CREATE DOCUMENT ----------');\n  const newDocData = {\n    name: `Test Document ${new Date().toISOString()}`,\n    description: \"Created by permission test script\",\n    isPublic: true,\n    ownerType: 1\n  };\n  \n  const newDocument = await makeRequest('POST', '/documents', newDocData);\n  let documentId = null;\n  \n  if (newDocument && newDocument.id) {\n    console.log('Successfully created document');\n    console.log('Document ID:', newDocument.id);\n    console.log('Document Name:', newDocument.name);\n    documentId = newDocument.id;\n    createDocumentAccess = true;\n    testDocumentAccess = true;\n  }\n\n  // Optional Test 4: Delete the created document (Delete access)\n  if (documentId) {\n    console.log('\\n---------- TEST 4: DELETE DOCUMENT ----------');\n    const deleteResult = await makeRequest('DELETE', `/documents/${documentId}`);\n    \n    if (deleteResult) {\n      console.log('Successfully deleted document');\n      deleteAccess = true;\n    }\n  }\n\n  // Summary section\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('PERMISSIONS SUMMARY');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  \n  if (globalScopeInfo && globalScopeInfo.scopes.length > 0) {\n    console.log('API Key OAuth Scopes:', globalScopeInfo.formatted);\n    console.log(`Read permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.read ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Write permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.write ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`Delete permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.delete ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log(`ReadPII permission: ${globalScopeInfo.has.readPII ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n    console.log('---------------------------------------------');\n  }\n  \n  console.log(`Test document access: ${testDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`User info access: ${userInfoAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`List documents: ${listDocumentsAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`Create documents: ${createDocumentAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  console.log(`Delete documents: ${deleteAccess ? ' Yes' : ' No'}`);\n  \n  // Provide guidance based on the results\n  console.log('\\n=============================================');\n  console.log('RECOMMENDATIONS');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n  if (!userInfoAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key may be invalid or expired. Create a new API key.');\n  } else if (!listDocumentsAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Read scope. Add this scope in the Developer Portal.');\n  } else if (!createDocumentAccess) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Write scope. Add this scope in the Developer Portal.');\n  } else if (!deleteAccess && globalScopeInfo && !globalScopeInfo.has.delete) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2Delete scope. Add this if you need to delete documents.');\n  } else if (globalScopeInfo && !globalScopeInfo.has.readPII) {\n    console.log(' Your API key lacks OAuth2ReadPII scope. Add this if you need access to personal information.');\n  } else {\n    console.log(' Your API key has all the required permissions!');\n  }\n  \n  console.log('\\nRecommended scope format for Onshape: OAuth2ReadPII OAuth2Read OAuth2Write OAuth2Delete');\n  console.log('=============================================');\n}\n```\n\nThis updated code:\n\n1. Initializes all summary variables at the beginning of the function to avoid undefined errors\n2. Adds a missing test for document deletion capability\n3. Enhances the summary section with more detailed information\n4. Displays recommended OAuth scope format that follows Onshape's passport format\n5. Provides more specific recommendations based on the test results\n6. Adds better error handling and reporting\n\nThe error occurred because variables like `testDocumentAccess` were being referenced without being initialized. This fix ensures all variables are properly defined before they're used in the summary section.",
